<title>Mac Screenshot Shortcut Keys</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/mac-screenshot-shortcut-keys/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 19 Aug 2009 07:55:34 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Keys]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="keys"><![CDATA[Keys]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Macbook]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="macbook"><![CDATA[Macbook]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Screenshots]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="screenshots"><![CDATA[Screenshots]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Shortcuts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="shortcuts"><![CDATA[Shortcuts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=276</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don't need to take screen shots from my Mac very often, and when I do I usually use the Evernote clipper.

However, occasionally I need to use the Mac method and of course can never remember the key combination...

Do you have the same problem.

If so here they are ! ! 

<ul><li> Command-Shift-3: Take a screenshot of the screen, and save it as a file on the desktop

</li><li> Command-Shift-4, then select an area: Take a screenshot of an area and save it as a file on the desktop
</li><li> Command-Shift-4, then space, then click a window: Take a screenshot of a window and save it as a file on the desktop
</li><li> Command-Control-Shift-3: Take a screenshot of the screen, and save it to the clipboard
</li><li> Command-Control-Shift-4, then select an area: Take a screenshot of an area and save it to the clipboard
</li><li> Command-Control-Shift-4, then space, then click a window: Take a screenshot of a window and save it to the clipboard
</li></ul>
<p>In Leopard, the following keys can be held down while selecting an area (via Command-Shift-4 or Command-Control-Shift-4):
</p>
<ul><li> Space, to lock the size of the selected region and instead move it when the mouse moves

</li><li> Shift, to resize only one edge of the selected region
</li><li> Option, to resize the selected region with its center as the anchor point
</li></ul>


<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/27388557@N07/3820346201" title="View 'MacBook' on Flickr.com"><div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2429/3820346201_7de1267cdf_o.jpg" alt="MacBook Keyboard" border="0" width="450"/></div></a>]]></content:encoded>

<title>AppleInsider &#124; iPhone sales predicted to top 80 million by 2012</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/appleinsider-iphone-sales-predicted-to-top-80-million-by-2012/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 19 Aug 2009 21:06:25 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Forecast]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="forecast"><![CDATA[Forecast]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Sales]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sales"><![CDATA[Sales]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=283</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><a href="http://www.appleinsider.com/articles/09/08/19/iphone_sales_predicted_to_top_80_million_by_2012.html">AppleInsider | iPhone sales predicted to top 80 million by 2012</a>: ""</p>

New reports forecast that Apple will sell 50 million phones in 2011, and more than 80 million in 2012, as worldwide expansion and popularity of the iPhone continues to grow.

Apple shipped 13.7 million iPhones in the 2008 calendar year, and the number continues to grow. Last quarter alone, the Cupertino, Calif., company sold 5.2 million iPhones riding the successful launch of the iPhone 3GS. But two new predictions call for the mobile platform to reach astounding new heights worldwide in the next few years.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/8853192D-CD7E-466A-BE15-15FE5045DCEB.jpg" alt="8853192D-CD7E-466A-BE15-15FE5045DCEB.jpg" border="0" width="200" height="255" /></div>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>283</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2009-08-19 22:06:25</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-08-19 21:06:25</wp:post_date_gmt>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don't find that I need a dock for my iPhone

I try to sync it as little as possible and charge it using the socket charger

However seeing this home made iPhone Dock makes me want to start using one!

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/BE96043E-CC88-4AB0-A80A-888D2216A1E1.jpg" alt="BE96043E-CC88-4AB0-A80A-888D2216A1E1.jpg" border="0" width="450"/></div>

I think you could get green credits for doing this as well

<a href="http://www.iphonesavior.com/2009/08/this-diy-iphone-3gs-box-dock-is-simply-perfect.html">Click here</a> to see how to make this great iPhone Dock ]]></content:encoded>

<title>Netgear 8-port Gigabit Firewall for Small Business</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/netgear-8-port-gigabit-firewall-for-small-business/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 20 Aug 2009 10:57:52 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Firewall]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="firewall"><![CDATA[Firewall]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Gigabit]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="gigabit"><![CDATA[Gigabit]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Netgear]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="netgear"><![CDATA[Netgear]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Security]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="security"><![CDATA[Security]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Small Business]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="small-business"><![CDATA[Small Business]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[SMB]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="smb"><![CDATA[SMB]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=293</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Netgear has announced the availability of its ProSafe 8-Port VPN Firewall (model FVS318G). It's priced at $139.

Hopefully available in the UK soon...

The device is intended for small businesses that need remote access and Internet access for employees with secure connections. It provides Virtual Private Networking (VPN) access using the Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) standard, and sports eight Gigabit Ethernet ports, one Gigabit Wide Area Network (WAN) port and up to 25 megabit per second broadband throughput.<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/F17A4DB2-6ABE-42C0-8CA7-2D6AAE18E797.jpg" alt="F17A4DB2-6ABE-42C0-8CA7-2D6AAE18E797.jpg" border="0" width="188" height="133" align="right" />

The new firewall also employs a software-configurable hardware DMZ port to help facilitate a server connection or another connection for a device on the network that remote users need to access.




<a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/redirect.html?ie=UTF8&location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.co.uk%2FNetgear-Routers-Adapters-Servers%2Fb%3Fie%3DUTF8%26node%3D15836341%26ref%255F%3Damb%255Flink%255F42306165%255F3&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=ur2&camp=1634&creative=19450">See other Netgear products at the Amazon Netgear Store</a><img src="https://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=ur2&o=2" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" />]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>Occam&#039;s razor</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/occams-razor/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 20 Aug 2009 12:50:46 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="funny"><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Books]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="books"><![CDATA[Books]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Neal Asher]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="neal-asher"><![CDATA[Neal Asher]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Occam's razor]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="occams-razor"><![CDATA[Occam's razor]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Sci-Fi]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sci-fi"><![CDATA[Sci-Fi]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Science Fiction]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="science-fiction"><![CDATA[Science Fiction]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=296</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occam%27s_razor">From Wikipedia</a><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/Picture-1.png" alt="Picture 1.png" border="0" width="148" height="154" align="right" />

<b>Occam's razor</b> or <b>Ockham's razor</b> is the principle that "entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily" or, popularly applied, "when you have two competing theories that make exactly the same predictions, the simpler one is the better.

It is <a href="/wiki/Apocrypha" title="Apocrypha">apocryphally</a> attributed to 14th-century English <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logician" title="Logician" class="mw-redirect">logician</a> and <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franciscan" title="Franciscan">Franciscan</a> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friar" title="Friar">friar</a>, <a href="/wiki/William_of_Ockham" title="William of Ockham">William of Ockham</a>. The principle states that the explanation of any <a href="/wiki/Phenomenon" title="Phenomenon">phenomenon</a> should make as few assumptions as possible, eliminating those that make no difference in the observable predictions of the explanatory <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypothesis" title="Hypothesis">hypothesis</a> or <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theory" title="Theory">theory</a>. The principle is often expressed in <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin" title="Latin">Latin</a> as the <i><b>lex parsimoniae</b></i> ("<b>law of <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parsimony" title="Parsimony">parsimony</a></b>", "<b>law of economy</b>", or "<b>law of succinctness</b>"): <i>entia non sunt multiplicanda praeter necessitatem</i>, roughly translated as "entities must not be multiplied beyond necessity." An alternative version <i>Pluralitas non est ponenda sine necessitate</i> translates "plurality should not be posited without necessity."</p>

<p>When competing hypotheses are equal in other respects, the principle recommends selection of the hypothesis that introduces the fewest assumptions and postulates the fewest entities while still sufficiently answering the question. It is in this sense that Occam's razor is usually understood. To quote <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isaac_Newton" title="Isaac Newton">Isaac Newton</a>: "We are to admit no more causes of natural things than such as are both true and sufficient to explain their appearances. Therefore, to the same natural effects we must, so far as possible, assign the same causes."</p>
<p>To summarize the common understanding of the principle, "Of several acceptable explanations for a phenomenon, the simplest is preferable, provided that it takes all circumstances into account."</p>
<p>Originally a tenet of the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reductionism" title="Reductionism">reductionist</a> philosophy of <a href="/wiki/Nominalism" title="Nominalism">nominalism</a>, it is more often taken today as a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heuristic" title="Heuristic">heuristic</a> <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxim_(philosophy)" title="Maxim (philosophy)">maxim</a> (rule of thumb) that advises economy, parsimony, or simplicity, often or especially in <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_theory" title="Scientific theory">scientific theories</a>. Here the same caveat applies to confounding topicality with mere simplicity. A superficially simple phenomenon may have a complex mechanism behind it. A simple explanation would be simplistic if it failed to capture all the essential and relevant parts. Instead, one should choose the simplest explanation that explains the most data.</p>

<p>The word "razor" in this sense is not derived from <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Razor" title="Razor">shaving razor</a>, rather both terms derive from the verb <i>to raze</i>, the "cutting away of extraneous material".<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference">


Also features in a great book by one of my favourite authors:

<iframe src="http://rcm-uk.amazon.co.uk/e/cm?lt1=_blank&bc1=000000&IS2=1&bg1=FFFFFF&fc1=000000&lc1=0000FF&t=alsda-21&o=2&p=8&l=as1&m=amazon&f=ifr&md=0M5A6TN3AXP2JHJBWT02&asins=0330471260" style="width:120px;height:240px;" scrolling="no" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" frameborder="0"></iframe>

]]></content:encoded>

<title>Use the same gMail account for more than one online account..</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=298</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 24 Aug 2009 09:34:18 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=298</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Great Scott ! ! I didn't know you could do this...

Apparently if you use a full stop anywhere in your e-mail address Google will ignore but most online services will consider it as a separate address.

i.e. bob.bob@gmail.com and bobbob@gmail.com will both end up in the same gmail mailbox, but can be separate accounts on most web services.

This way you can sign up for more than one account with the same online provider, but get your email in a single inbox...

Groovy...

<a href="http://lifehacker.com/5341896/use-the-same-gmail-account-for-multiple-online-accounts">Source</a>

]]></content:encoded>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[Great Scott ! ! I didn't know you could do this...

Apparently if you use a full stop anywhere in your e-mail address Google will ignore but most online services will consider it as a separate address.

i.e. bob.bob@gmail.com and bobbob@gmail.com will both end up in the same gmail mailbox, but can be separate accounts on most web services.

This way you can sign up for more than one account with the same online provider, but get your email in a single inbox...

Groovy...

<content:encoded><![CDATA[Great Scott ! ! I didn't know you could do this...

Apparently if you use a full stop anywhere in your e-mail address Google will ignore but most online services will consider it as a separate address.

i.e. bob.bob@gmail.com and bobbob@gmail.com will both end up in the same gmail mailbox, but can be separate accounts on most web services.

This way you can sign up for more than one account with the same online provider, but get your email in a single inbox...

Groovy...

<a href="http://lifehacker.com/5341896/use-the-same-gmail-account-for-multiple-online-accounts">Source</a>

<item>
<title>Optimize Firefox SQLite Databases</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/optimize-firefox-sqlite-databases/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 24 Aug 2009 19:08:47 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Firefox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="firefox"><![CDATA[Firefox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=305</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/EA32F5C2-765D-4301-A19C-74620B34B116.jpg" alt="EA32F5C2-765D-4301-A19C-74620B34B116.jpg" border="0" width="450" /></div>

<strong>1.</strong> Open the Error Console: Tools menu/Error Console

<strong>2.</strong> In the Code text box paste this (itâ€™s a single line):

Components.classes["@mozilla.org/browser/nav-history-service;1"].getService(Components.interfaces.nsPIPlacesDatabase).DBConnection.executeSimpleSQL("VACUUM");

<strong>3.</strong> Press Evaluate. All the UI will freeze for a few seconds while databases are VACUUMed.]]></content:encoded>

<title>Microsoft confirms Â£150 Windows 7 Family Pack</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/microsoft-confirms-150-windows-7-family-pack/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2009 07:52:03 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=313</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.pcpro.co.uk/news/351049/microsoft-confirms-150-windows-7-family-pack">PCPro</a> are reporting that Microsoft has decided to bring its Windows 7 Family Pack to the UK after all. 

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/46797499-83F5-4630-84D5-5CDB18C22E64.jpg" alt="46797499-83F5-4630-84D5-5CDB18C22E64.jpg" border="0" width="175" height="131" align="right" />


The company will offer buyers the chance to upgrade up to three PCs to Windows 7 for Â£150. Users can upgrade from either Windows XP or Vista, although only Vista users will be able to perform an in-place upgrade where programs, settings and data are kept intact.

Microsoft says the Family Pack will only be available in "limited quantities" when it goes on sale on 22 October, the Windows 7 launch date. ]]></content:encoded>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here's a neat way to maybe put off freeloaders from hopping on your Wi-Fi connection.

Simply rename you access point as follows:

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/4A684B0A-E8EC-4EEE-8354-36FD3A9E1870.jpg" alt="4A684B0A-E8EC-4EEE-8354-36FD3A9E1870.jpg" border="0" width="361" height="292" /></div>

Nice..

<title>Nokia vows to challenge Apple&#039;s iPhone</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/nokia-vows-to-challenge-apples-iphone/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2009 13:08:02 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="technology"><![CDATA[Technology]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=318</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/1a8c6966-9046-11de-bc59-00144feabdc0.html">From the FT</a>

Nokia has pledged to strike back at Apple and produce mobile phones that will compete effectively with the US technology company's iPhone.

Olli-Pekka Kallasvuo, chief executive of Nokia, the world's largest mobile phone maker, said that it was aiming to be "even more competitive" following criticism that it had failed to come up with a handset to match the iPhone.

Mr Kallasvuo also insisted that Nokia would succeed with its strategy of transforming itself from a mobile maker into a supplier of services on handsets, such as maps and music.

]]></content:encoded>

<title>Minimal Mac - 2 Favourites </title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=327</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2009 13:46:50 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Spiritedaway]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="spiritedaway"><![CDATA[Spiritedaway]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=327</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[I'm really enjoying he <a href="http://minimalmac.com/">Minimal Mac</a> blog at the moment

I've used quite a few tips from the site and am really getting into the Minimal Mac ethos... (although I haven't got ride of my Dock completely yet, I have made it smaller ! !)

Two favourite bits of software that I've downloaded after Minimal Mac recommended them are <a href="http://drikin.com/spiritedaway/">Spirited Away</a> and http://www.emeraldion.it/software/widgets/minibatterystatus.html

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/BB42082C-7775-402E-9CF5-558BCA090B374.jpg" alt="BB42082C-7775-402E-9CF5-558BCA090B37.jpg" border="0" width="141" height="140" align="left" />

<strong>Spirited Away </strong>checks each running application's activity, and if an application isn't active for a certain fixed time, Spirited Away hides the application automatically

This really help to keep your desktop uncluttered and I'm finding it really helps keep my mind uncluttered

It also means I get to see some of those really nice wallpapers I spent all that time setting up ! !


<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/63E002EB-9DC7-405B-B164-70FD85BBAAEB.jpg" alt="63E002EB-9DC7-405B-B164-70FD85BBAAEB.jpg" border="0" width="201" height="100" align="right" /><strong>MiniBatteryStatus</strong> is a small Dashboard widget that monitors battery status, charge percentage and remaining battery life. Integrated with Growl to alert you when it's time to recharge your battery.

I really like this as it means less junk in my menu bar (I've removed the battery icon from here) and <a href="http://growl.info/">Growl</a> lets me know when I need to take some action

]]></content:encoded>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[I'm really enjoying he <a href="http://minimalmac.com/">Minimal Mac</a> blog at the moment

I've used quite a few tips from the site and am really getting into the Minimal Mac ethos... (although I haven't got ride of my Dock completely yet, I have made it smaller ! !)

Two favourite bits of software that I've downloaded after Minimal Mac recommended them are <a href="http://drikin.com/spiritedaway/">Spirited Away</a> and http://www.emeraldion.it/software/widgets/minibatterystatus.html

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/BB42082C-7775-402E-9CF5-558BCA090B374.jpg" alt="BB42082C-7775-402E-9CF5-558BCA090B37.jpg" border="0" width="141" height="140" align="left" />

<strong>Spirited Away </strong>checks each running application's activity, and if an application isn't active for a certain fixed time, Spirited Away hides the application automatically

This really help to keep your desktop uncluttered and I'm finding it really helps keep my mind uncluttered

It also means I get to see some of those really nice wallpapers I spent all that time setting up ! !


<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/63E002EB-9DC7-405B-B164-70FD85BBAAEB.jpg" alt="63E002EB-9DC7-405B-B164-70FD85BBAAEB.jpg" border="0" width="201" height="100" align="right" /><strong>MiniBatteryStatus</strong> is a small Dashboard widget that monitors battery status, charge percentage and remaining battery life. Integrated with Growl to alert you when it's time to recharge your battery.

I really like this as it means less junk in my menu bar (I've removed the battery icon from here) and <a href="http://growl.info/">Growl</a> lets me know when I need to take some action

<item>
<title>Digital Music Can Save the Planet  </title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/digital-music-can-save-the-planet/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2009 17:19:15 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Carbon]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="carbon"><![CDATA[Carbon]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="digital"><![CDATA[digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Enviroment]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="enviroment"><![CDATA[Enviroment]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Footprint]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="footprint"><![CDATA[Footprint]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPod]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ipod"><![CDATA[iPod]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Music]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="music"><![CDATA[Music]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[planet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="planet"><![CDATA[planet]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=332</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.greatgreentoys.co.uk/blog/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/3865CF3B-5ABD-4786-8ACF-AE8015BDDCC6.jpg" alt="3865CF3B-5ABD-4786-8ACF-AE8015BDDCC6.jpg" border="0" width="468" height="183" /></div>

A new study conducted by researchers from Carnegie Mellon University, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory and Stanford University confirms what we already assumed:  downloading music cuts energy consumption and CO2 emissions compared to shopping at your local record store.  Digitizing wins again.

The study found that buying digital music results in a 40 to 80 percent reduction in energy use and carbon emissions compared to distributing CDs, and that factors in the energy used to download the files over the Internet.  The study compared four different ways of obtaining and listening to music, listed from most energy intensive to the least:  buying a CD in-person at a record store, buying a CD online, downloading an album and then burning it to a CD (both with and without a jewel case) and downloading an album and listening to it digitally.

There were some situations that blurred the lines.  If you walked to the music store instead of driving, that would equal the energy and emissions of downloading and then burning an album to disc, meaning the driving to the store is the worst part of buying music in person.  Also, if the album size is 260 MB (compared to the standard 60 to 100 MB) or more, then that would equal the energy and emissions of buying a CD online because of the extra energy needed to download it.

So, the moral of the story is:  download your music and keep it on your computer or iPod.  Luckily, that's what most of us are already doing.

via <a href="http://ecogeek.org/digitizing/2926-digital-music-can-save-the-planet">ecogeek.org</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>eBay Sells Skype</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/ebay-sells-skype/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 01 Sep 2009 17:52:52 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ebay]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ebay"><![CDATA[ebay]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[skype]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="skype"><![CDATA[skype]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=338</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Online auction site eBay has agreed to sell the majority of internet phone company Skype for about $2bn (Â£1.2bn).

Skype is to be majority-owned by a group of private investors, including Netscape co-founder Marc Andreessen and private equity firms.<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/366CDAA1-94A4-42EC-8F1E-EA0CF1EFE30F.jpg" alt="366CDAA1-94A4-42EC-8F1E-EA0CF1EFE30F.jpg" border="0" width="105" height="47" align="right" />

EBay will keep a 35% stake in the firm, which it has been trying to sell for some time. It has said that Skype had "limited synergies" with it.

The deal values Skype at $2.75bn. EBay bought Skype for $2.6bn in 2005.

The new owners are Andreessen Horowitz, Index Ventures - which originally invested in Skype - as well as private equity firm Silver Lake and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board.

They will pay $1.9bn in cash, and give a $125m note to eBay, meaning that it promises to pay that amount on demand or at an agreed time.

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/4BE40D33-F973-4E21-A9EF-5DDC4988A51B.jpg" alt="4BE40D33-F973-4E21-A9EF-5DDC4988A51B.jpg" border="0" width="226" height="170" align="left" />Earlier this year, eBay had said that it planned to spin off Skype and list its shares in the first half of 2010, an announcement many took as a signal that the firm was for sale.

Ebay wrote down the value of the firm to $1.2bn a year after it was taken over.

Including payouts to Niklas Zennstrom and Janus Friis, who founded Skype in 2003, eBay paid over $3bn for the company.

Skype's software lets computer and mobile phone users talk to each other for free and make cut-price calls to mobiles and landlines.

Unlike traditional mobile calls, which are transmitted over a cellular network, Skype turns your voice into data and sends it over the internet.

Since being acquired, the number of registered Skype users has risen to 405 million from 53 million, though free user-to-user calls still dominate the service.

The deal should be finalised by the last three months of the year. ]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Toshiba touts 640GB laptop hard drive</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/toshiba-touts-640gb-laptop-hard-drive/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 02 Sep 2009 17:20:19 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hitachi]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hitachi"><![CDATA[Hitachi]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Toshiba]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="toshiba"><![CDATA[Toshiba]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=340</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Not to be outdone by Hitachi's new 7200rpm, 500GB 2.5in hard drive, rival disk maker Toshiba has announced a 640GB model, though it only spins at 5400rpm.

The full capacity is delivered on just two storage platters thanks to a data density of 528.5Gb per square inch. It means the capacity can be delivered without upping the drive's height beyond 9.5mm.

Toshiba also claimed such a high density makes the product more environmentally friendly: fewer components mean less carbon-dioxide is released during the drive's manufacture, it said.

The drive contains 8MB of buffer memory, and connects across a 3Gb/s Sata bus.

Versions of the drive will also be made available with capacities of 500GB, 320GB, 250GB and 160GB. PC manufacturers will be able to buy the drives in Q4

<a href="http://www.reghardware.co.uk/2009/09/02/toshiba_640gb_laptop_drive/">From </a>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Govt anti-piracy measures threaten broadband consumersâ€™ rights says industry</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/govt-anti-piracy-measures-threaten-broadband-consumers%e2%80%99-rights-says-industry/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 03 Sep 2009 18:47:29 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Broadband]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="broadband"><![CDATA[Broadband]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Copyright]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="copyright"><![CDATA[Copyright]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[File Sharing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="file-sharing"><![CDATA[File Sharing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Government]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="government"><![CDATA[Government]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Piracy]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="piracy"><![CDATA[Piracy]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Pirate Bay]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="pirate-bay"><![CDATA[Pirate Bay]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[UK]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="uk"><![CDATA[UK]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=343</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/673C44AC-59D9-46F0-9D76-1DD1E8C4BDC2.jpg" alt="673C44AC-59D9-46F0-9D76-1DD1E8C4BDC2.jpg" border="0" width="200" height="137" align="right" />

TalkTalk, BT, Orange and Which? are amongst leading telecoms companies and consumer groups who believe the Governmentâ€™s latest proposals on the â€˜howâ€™ to reduce illegal filesharing are misconceived.

Labour's Lord Mandelson's proposal is that people who illegally download films and music should have their Internet connection cut. 

Writing in <a href="http://redirectingat.com/?id=803X112722&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.timesonline.co.uk%2Ftol%2Fcomment%2Fletters%2Farticle6819093.ece">The Times</a> newspaper, Charles Dunstone of TalkTalk, Ian Livingston of BT, Tom Alexander of Orange UK, Deborah Prince of Which?, Jim Killock of Open Rights Group and Ed Mayo of Consumer Focus said such plans threaten broadband consumersâ€™ rights and the development of new attractive services.

"First, any decision to move to harsh and punitive measures such as disconnection must be genuinely underpinned by rigorous and objective assessment by Ofcom," the group write in The Times.

"Second, consumers must be presumed to be innocent unless proven guilty. We must avoid an extra-judicial â€˜kangaroo courtâ€™ process where evidence is not properly tested and accused broadband users are denied the right to defend themselves against false accusations. Without these protections innocent customers will suffer."

"Third, any penalty must be proportionate. Disconnecting users from the internet would place serious limits on their freedom of expression. Usually constraints to freedom of expression are only imposed as the result of custodial sentences, or incitement to racial hatred, or libel."

"Fourth, the proposal that ISPs and by implication broadband customers should pay most of the cost of these measures to support the creative industries is grossly unfair since the vast majority of consumers do not illegally fileshare. Further, this payment approach would discourage content industries from developing new services." 

<a href="http://www.macworld.co.uk/digitallifestyle/news/index.cfm?RSS&NewsID=27084">From...</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Western Digital 7200RPM 2TB desktop hard drives: Caviar Black and RE4</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/western-digital-7200rpm-2tb-desktop-hard-drives-caviar-black-and-re4/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 04 Sep 2009 10:24:22 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Cariar]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="cariar"><![CDATA[Cariar]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Components]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="components"><![CDATA[Components]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Computer Help]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="computer-help"><![CDATA[Computer Help]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Computers Parts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="computers-parts"><![CDATA[Computers Parts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hard-drives"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="western-digital"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=346</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/64542237-5BC8-44CE-8EDE-EDF1CA4377AE.jpg" alt="64542237-5BC8-44CE-8EDE-EDF1CA4377AE.jpg" border="0" width="550" /></div>


The Caviar Black (shown left) and RE4 (shown right) are both four-platter drives boast 64MB of cache, a dual stage actuator, 3Gbps SATA interface and an integrated dual processor. The latter also promises 1.2 million hours MTBF, Active Power Save, a multi-axis shock sensor and a few other high-end advancements designed for enterprise users seeking long-term reliability.

<a href="http://www.engadget.com/2009/09/01/wd-ships-7200rpm-2tb-desktop-hard-drives-caviar-black-and-re4/">From</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="x600"><![CDATA[X600]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=349</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[MSI has formally launched its MacBook Air-alike X600 skinny laptop in the UK, releasing two models: one with an optical drive and one without.

Actually, neither has a built-in DVD burner, it's just that one model, the X600-055UK, comes bundled with an external unit. Priced at Â£799, it's Â£200 more than the X600-067UK.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/F839A50E-39F3-4780-A31E-D34B8B73AD4D.jpg" alt="F839A50E-39F3-4780-A31E-D34B8B73AD4D.jpg" border="0" width="450" height="305" /></div>

<item>
<title>iStat Menus now plays nice with Snow Leopard</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/istat-menus-now-plays-nice-with-snow-leopard/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 07 Sep 2009 13:54:49 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iStat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="istat"><![CDATA[iStat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Snow Leopard]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="snow-leopard"><![CDATA[Snow Leopard]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=354</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/F0FF94B4-E4E1-484E-8027-8F82D05CDBE8.jpg" alt="F0FF94B4-E4E1-484E-8027-8F82D05CDBE8.jpg" border="0" width="247" height="247" align="right" />

Sometimes you don't know how much you rely on something until its gone...

After dutifully upgrading to Snow Leopard I took a quick look at my menu bar to see all that saved disk space and better performance being nicely displayed in my iStat Menu installation...

 and it wasn't there! !

So I rushed to System Preferences and it was clearly not working, or sorrow oh pain....

The iSlayer site reported that all would be well with version 2

And now, thank you iSlayer, V2 is out and rocking my menu bar once more.

Thank you...

<a href="http://islayer.com/apps/istatmenus/">Get iStat Menu Version 2.0 here </a> and don't forget to make a donation !
]]></content:encoded>

<strong>Version 1.5 Adds Save for Web, Snow Leopard Support, and More
</strong>

The Pixelmator Team released Pixelmator 1.5 today, an update to the revolutionary GPU-powered image editing tool that provides everything needed to create, edit, and enhance still images. Available as a free software update, Pixelmator 1.5, codenamed Spider, features Save for Web, a Slice tool, a Trim tool, Info Labels, and more. 

â€œPixelmator is a perfect fit for anyone who is passionate about image editing,â€ said Saulius Dailide of the Pixelmator Team. â€œAnd now with the breakthrough version 1.5 Spider features, Pixelmator becomes one of the worldâ€™s best tools for exporting images for the Web.â€

<a href="http://www.pixelmator.com/weblog/2009/09/08/pixelmator-team-releases-pixelmator-1-5-spider/">Get Pixelmator now</a> - great value for money and a very fast and powerful tool.]]></content:encoded>

<title>Optical computer does its first math</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/optical-computer-does-its-first-math/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 08 Sep 2009 20:59:17 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Future]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="future"><![CDATA[Future]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Technology]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="technology"><![CDATA[Technology]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=359</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The first ever calculation has been performed by an optical computer. It wasn't a really hard sum - finding the prime factors of 15 - but it's a huge step towards the creation of a quantum computer.

The chip takes four photons that carry the input for the calculation, and then implements a quantum program called Shorâ€™s algorithm to find and output the answer â€“ 3 and 5, as any fule no.  Finding prime factors is the basis of modern encryption schemes, including those used for secure internet communication.

â€œThis task could be done much faster by any school kid, but this is a really important proof-of-principle demonstration,â€ said PhD student Alberto Politi from the University of Bristol.

<a href="http://www.tgdaily.com/content/view/43872/135/">From...</a>]]></content:encoded>

<pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 18:37:05 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=365</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/6823B18A-8D3C-46BB-A77E-86CD5AE87701.jpg" alt="6823B18A-8D3C-46BB-A77E-86CD5AE87701.jpg" border="0" width="188" height="131" align="left" /> Apple is today releasing version 3.1 of its iPhone operating system.

The update is free to all iPhone owners.

It's main feature is a Genius service that will recommend apps based on the apps your already own in the same way as the Genius feature works in iTunes.

Neat...]]></content:encoded>

<title>Western Digital Scorpio Blue 640GB Notebook Drives Released</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/western-digital-scorpio-blue-640gb-notebook-drives-released/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 18:42:03 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hard-drives"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Laptop]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="laptop"><![CDATA[Laptop]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Notebooks]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="notebooks"><![CDATA[Notebooks]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="western-digital"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=370</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Western Digital today said it has commenced volume shipments of its 2.5-inch WD Scorpio Blue 640GB hard drives designed for notebooks.

The tiny drives pack 640GB into a single unit by way of 320GB per platter technology, making them the highest capacity 2.5-inch hard drives in the industry standard 9.5mm, 2-disk form factor yet available. On the energy efficiency front, WD claims its capacious Scropio Blue drive consumes 30 percent less power than previous generation WD Scorpio Blue models.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/A2C7F451-AC76-4658-889F-570C15AC786F.jpg" alt="A2C7F451-AC76-4658-889F-570C15AC786F.jpg" border="0" width="350" height="195" /></div>


<b>Features of the WD Scorpio Blue include:</b><ul> <br /> <li><b>WhisperDrive&trade;</b> - WD's exclusive WhisperDrive technology combines state-of-the-art seeking algorithms to produce one of the quietest 2.5-inch drives available;  <br /> <li><b>ShockGuard&trade;</b> - Leading-edge ShockGuard technology combines firmware and hardware advancements to meet the highest combined shock tolerance specifications required for mobile and notebook applications; and, <br /> <li><b>IntelliSeek&trade;</b> - A unique feature, IntelliSeek technology calculates optimum seek speeds to lower power consumption, noise and vibration.</li></ul>

Now will one of these fit in my Macbook..?

Does anybody know..?

<a href="http://www.maximumpc.com/article/news/western_digital_scropio_blue_640gb_notebook_drives_now_shipping">Source</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>iTunes 9 - Everything you wanted and more..?</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/itunes-9-everything-you-wanted-and-more/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 18:52:47 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iTunes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="itunes"><![CDATA[iTunes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software-release"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=375</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The latest version of iTunes brings improved syncing and application management, allows easier sharing of content, features a redesigned iTunes Store, and includes enhanced albums in the form of iTunes LPs.

A new Applications view allows users to view all of their iPod touch and iPhone home screens. The new feature will allow users to rearrange applications on the computer, designated which software goes where.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/5BAB1BCE-9EDA-45B9-9AAB-E56E6A3F6FD8.jpg" alt="5BAB1BCE-9EDA-45B9-9AAB-E56E6A3F6FD8.jpg" border="0" width="500"  /></div>

A redesigned iTunes store includes new artist, movie and TV pages, complete with improved navigation. The cleaner layout is designed to make it easier for customers to browse. The store also includes iTunes LPs, which will bring additional content, such as audio, video, pictures, liner notes and more, exclusively to full-album purchases.

Improved home sharing will let users copy songs, movies and TV shows among up to five authorized computers

The rumored social media integration in iTunes 9 because official as well. Links to content can be share directly with Facebook and Twitter.]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>What&#039;s new in iTunesÂ 9</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/whats-new-in-itunes%c2%a09/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 18:59:47 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iTunes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="itunes"><![CDATA[iTunes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software-release"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=377</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[iTunes 9 comes with many new features and improvements, including: 

â€¢Â An improved look and feel, including a new Column Browser for easily browsing your artists or albums, movies, TV shows, and more.

â€¢ iTunes Store has a brand new look, with improved navigation for quick and easy exploration.

â€¢Â iTunes LP and iTunes Extras create unique experiences that feature exclusive interviews, videos, photos, and more â€” available with select album and movie purchases on the iTunes Store.

â€¢ Home Sharing helps you manage your family's iTunes collection between computers in your home. iTunes can automatically transfer new purchases, or you can choose just the items you want.

â€¢ Genius Mixes are created for you by iTunes and play songs from your library that go great together.

â€¢ iPod and iPhone syncing now allows you to organize your iPhone and iPod touch home screens directly in iTunes. Syncing is now also more flexible, allowing you to sync individual artists, genres, or TV show and Podcast episodes.

â€¢ iTunes U items are now organized into their own section in your iTunes library.

â€¢ Sync with iPod nano (5th generation), iPod classic (Fall 2009), and iPod touch (Fall 2009).

â€¢Â iTunes 9 also includes many other improvements, such as HE-AAC encoding and playback, more flexibility with Smart Playlists rules, simpler organization of your media files inside an iTunes Media folder, and more.


From the iTunes 9 Read Me ]]></content:encoded>

<title>What&#039;s new in iPhone OS 3.1</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/whats-new-in-iphone-os-3-1/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 09 Sep 2009 20:15:46 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[3.1]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="3-1"><![CDATA[3.1]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software-release"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=380</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/29B4652B-5995-484F-A82A-5D5B0A425B79.jpg" alt="29B4652B-5995-484F-A82A-5D5B0A425B79.jpg" border="0" width="225" height="336" align="left" /> <ul>
    <li>Improved syncing for music, movies, TV shows, podcasts, and photos</li>

    <li>iTunes U content organization</li>

    <li>Redeem iTunes Gift Cards, codes, and certificates in the App Store</li>

    <li>Display available iTunes account credits in the App Store and iTunes Store</li>

    <li>Save video from Mail and MMS into Camera Roll</li>

    <li>Option to Save as new clip when trimming a video on iPhone 3GS</li>


    <li>Better iPhone 3G Wi-Fi performance when Bluetooth is turned on</li>

    <li>Remotely lock iPhone with passcode via MobileMe</li>

    <li>Use Voice COntrol on iPhone 3GS with Bluetooth headsets</li>

    <li>Paste phone numbers into the keypad</li>

    <li>Option to use Home button to turn on accessibility features on iPhone 3GS</li>

    <li>Warn when visiting fraudulent websites in Safari (anti-phishing)</li>

 <li>Improved Exchange calendar syncing and invitation handling</li>

    <li>Fixes issue that cause some app icons to display incorrectly</li>
</ul>
]]></content:encoded>

<title>Seagate 2TB Barracuda XT SATA 6Gbps hard drive</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/seagate-2tb-barracuda-xt-sata-6gbps-hard-drive/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 21 Sep 2009 16:49:19 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Barracuda]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="barracuda"><![CDATA[Barracuda]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hard-drives"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[SATA]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sata"><![CDATA[SATA]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Seagate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="seagate"><![CDATA[Seagate]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=386</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Seagate just announced the world's first 2TB disk with full support for the third generation SATA interface pushing data at 6Gbps -- double the rate of previous controllers.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/1F1ECBD2-8D1E-48E6-83E5-BB9C1FFA09EF.jpg" alt="1F1ECBD2-8D1E-48E6-83E5-BB9C1FFA09EF.jpg" border="0" width="450" height="315" /></div>

he 3.5-inch SATA 6Gbps Barracuda XT drive spins 4x 500GB platters at 7200RPM with a big 64MB cache to prevent bottlenecks. It promises a sustained transfer rate of just 140MBps (compared to 600MBps / 4.8Gbps possible), MTBF of 750,000 hours, and carries a five-year warranty.

<a href="http://www.engadget.com/2009/09/21/seagate-2tb-barracuda-xt-worlds-first-sata-6gbps-hard-drive/">Source</a>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<wp:post_date>2009-09-21 17:49:19</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-09-21 16:49:19</wp:post_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
<wp:ping_status>closed</wp:ping_status>
<wp:post_name>seagate-2tb-barracuda-xt-sata-6gbps-hard-drive</wp:post_name>

<title>iTunes 9.0.1 Released</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/itunes-9-0-1-released/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 23 Sep 2009 16:31:36 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=389</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[iTunes 9.0.1 provides a number of important bug fixes, including:

â€¢ Resolves issues browsing the iTunes Store. 
â€¢ Addresses a performance issue where iTunes may become unresponsive. 
â€¢ Fixes a problem where iTunes may unexpectedly quit. 
â€¢ Fixes a problem syncing Podcasts in playlists to iPod or iPhone. 
â€¢ Fixes a problem sorting albums with multiple discs. 
â€¢ Addresses an issue with the Zoom button not switching to Mini Player. 
â€¢ Improves application syncing for iPod touch and iPhone. 
â€¢ Genius is now automatically updated to show Genius Mixes.
iTunes 9 comes with many new features and improvements, including:

â€¢ An improved look and feel, including a new Column Browser for easily browsing your artists or albums, movies, TV shows, and more.

â€¢ iTunes Store has a brand new look, with improved navigation for quick and easy exploration.

â€¢ iTunes LP and iTunes Extras create unique experiences that feature exclusive interviews, videos, photos, and more â€” available with select album and movie purchases on the iTunes Store.

â€¢ Home Sharing helps you manage your family's iTunes collection between computers in your home. iTunes can automatically transfer new purchases, or you can choose just the items you want.

â€¢ Genius Mixes are created for you by iTunes and play songs from your library that go great together.

â€¢ iPod and iPhone syncing now allows you to organize your iPhone and iPod touch home screens directly in iTunes. Syncing is now also more flexible, allowing you to sync individual artists, genres, or TV show and Podcast episodes.

â€¢ iTunes U items are now organized into their own section in your iTunes library.

â€¢ Sync with iPod nano (5th generation), iPod classic (Fall 2009), and iPod touch (Fall 2009).

â€¢ iTunes 9 also includes many other improvements, such as HE-AAC encoding and playback, more flexibility with Smart Playlis

<content:encoded><![CDATA[Push for Gmail has been released by Google for the iPhone.  

It's long overdue according to some, but I'm not that it's that big a deal. 

Sometimes it's nice not to get an email straight away!!

What do you think?

Is this the killer feature you've been waiting for?

<item>
<title>70 Very Very Basic Unix Commands You Must Know, apparently...</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/70-very-very-basic-unix-commands-you-must-know-apparently/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 28 Sep 2009 16:14:48 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Commands]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="commands"><![CDATA[Commands]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Computer Help]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="computer-help"><![CDATA[Computer Help]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[IT]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="it"><![CDATA[IT]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Unix]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="unix"><![CDATA[Unix]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=395</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ul><strong>A) File Management Unix Commands</strong></ul>
<p><strong>Creating a File</strong></p>

<p><strong>1. $ cat > test</strong></p>
<p>Now hit the ENTER and start writing and then press CTRL + D to end the file.Your file is created whose name is test.</p>
<p><strong>Creating an empty File</strong></p>
<p><strong>2. $ touch file1</strong></p>
<p>It will create an empty file named file1.</p>
<p><strong>Displaying the Contents of the File</strong></p>
<p><strong>3. $ cat test</strong></p>
<p>It will display the contents of the file named test.</p>
<p><strong>Concatenating the two Files</strong></p>

<p><strong>4. $ cat file1 file2</strong></p>
<p>It will concatenate the file1 and file2</p>
<p><strong>Copying a File to another File</strong></p>
<p><strong>5. $ cp file1 file2</strong></p>
<p>It will copy the contents of file1 into a new file named file2</p>
<p><strong>Moving a File to another File</strong></p>
<p><strong>6. $ mv file1 file2</strong></p>
<p>It will move the contents of file1 into a new file named file2. Now file1 does not exists. This command is also indirectly used to rename a file. To move a file on parent directory we can use <strong>$ mv file1 ..</strong></p>

<p><strong>Deleting a File</strong></p>
<p><strong>7. $ rm file1</strong></p>
<p>It will delete file1. But always use <strong>$ rm -i file1</strong>. It will prompt you a message that you are sure to delete this file. If you press &#8216;y&#8217;, then it will delete it otherwise not.</p>
<p><strong>Appending a File to another File</strong></p>
<p><strong>8. $ file1 >> file2</strong></p>
<p>It will append the contents of file1 at the end of the file2.</p>
<p><strong>Displaying the type of a File</strong></p>

<p><strong>9. $ file file1</strong></p>
<p>It will display the type of file1 that is whether it is Binary File, Empty File, English Text or Binary Text. If you write <strong>$ file *</strong>, then it will display the type of all files in the current directory.</p>
<ul><strong>B) Directory Management Unix Commands</strong></ul>
<p><strong>Displaying the current working directory</strong></p>
<p><strong>10. $ pwd</strong></p>
<p>It will display the current directory in which you are working.</p>
<p><strong>Creating a Directory</strong></p>
<p><strong>11. $ mkdir dir1</strong></p>

<p>It will create a new directory named dir1.</p>
<p><strong>Removing a Directory</strong></p>
<p><strong>12. $ rmdir dir1</strong></p>
<p>It will remove the directory dir1.</p>
<p><strong>Changing a Directory</strong></p>
<p><strong>13. $ cd dir2</strong></p>
<p>It will take you to dir2 directory from your previous directory dir1.</p>
<ul><strong>C) File and Directory Listing Unix Commands</strong></ul>
<p><strong>14. $ ls *</strong> : lists all directories and files. </p>

<p><strong>15. $ ls t*</strong> will display all the files starting with t and also the files of directories whose name starts with t.</p>
<p><strong>16. $ ls [tT]*</strong> will display all the files starting with t or T and also the files of directories whose name starts with t or T.</p>
<p><strong>17. $ ls [m-t]*</strong> will display all the files whose first alphabet of name lies in the range of m and t and also the files of directories whose first alphabet of name lies in m and t.</p>
<p><strong>18. $ ls [!a-b]*</strong> will display all the files whose first alphabet of name don&#8217;t lies in the range of a and z and also the files of directories whose first alphabet of name don&#8217;t lies in a and z.</p>

<p><strong>19. $ ls -l</strong> : long lists all directories and files with some extra information.</p>
<p><strong>20. $ ls -p</strong> : lists all directories and files but will attach slash with the name of directories. But if you use <strong>$ ls -F</strong>, it will also list all directories and files but will attach slash with the name of directories and * with the name of executable files.</p>
<p><strong>21. $ ls -a</strong> : lists all files on your directory.</p>
<p><strong>22. $ ls -d</strong> : displays data about directories.</p>

<p><strong>23. $ ls -t </strong> : lists files in order of their last modification time. </p>
<p><strong>24. $ ls -lu</strong> :lists files in order of their last access time. </p>
<p><strong>25. $ ls -r</strong> : lists files in reverse alphabetical order.</p>
<p><strong>26. $ ls -Cs</strong> : lists all the files on your directory with a columnar format along the size of each file.</p>
<p><strong>27. $ ls -lR</strong> : lists all the files on your directory in a recursive manner.</p>

<p><strong>28. $ ls -ld t*</strong> : lists all directories and files starting the name with t.</p>
<ul><strong>D) Unix Date Commands</strong></ul>
<p><strong>29. $ date</strong> : Fri Feb 14 11:00:12 IST 2009</p>
<p>In order to customize date you can use following switches along with date command</p>
<p>+%D = mm/dd/yy<br />
+%H = hour (0 - 23)<br />
+%M = minute (0 - 59)<br />

+%S = second (0 - 59)<br />
+%T = HH:MM:SS<br />
+%w = Day of the week, sunday = 0<br />
+%a = abbreviated week day<br />
+%h = abbreviated month (jan - dec)<br />
+%r = time in AM /PM<br />
+%y = last two digits of a year</p>
<ul><strong>E) Unix General Command</strong></ul>
<p><strong>30. $ logname</strong> : displays your user name.</p>

<p><strong>31. $ who</strong> : displays information about all users sitting online like their   user name, terminal name and date and time</p>
<p><strong>32. $ who -H</strong> : displays information about all users sitting online like their user name, terminal name and date and time with proper headings</p>
<p><strong>33. $ who am i</strong> : displays information only about you like your user name, terminal name and date and time</p>
<p><strong>34. $ finger </strong> : displays information about all users sitting online like their   user name, terminal name and date and time and much more.</p>
<p><strong>35. $ tput </strong> : clears the screen</p>

<p><strong>36. $ cal </strong> : displays the calendar</p>
<p><strong>37. $ bc </strong> : calculator</p>
<p><strong>38. $ echo Learning unix is fun </strong> : displays the string &#8220;Learning unix is fun&#8221;</p>
<p><strong>39. $ banner Learning unix is fun </strong> : displays the string &#8220;Learning unix is fun&#8221; in a stylish way.</p>

<p><strong>40. $ man pwd </strong> : displays the mannual of pwd command.</p>
<p><strong>41. $ uname </strong> : displays the system on which you are working.</p>
<p><strong>42. $ uname -a </strong> : displays more info about the system on which you are working like name of the operating system, node and the version of the unix.</p>
<p><strong>43. $ uname -X </strong> : displays detailed listing of info of unix.</p>
<p><strong>44. $ id </strong> : displays id of the user</p>

<p><strong>45. $ tty </strong> : displays name of the terminal of the user</p>
<p><strong>46. $ sleep 5</strong> : the system will sleep for 5 seconds</p>
<p><strong>47. $ spell file1 </strong> : will display all the words which are misspelt in the file file1.</p>
<p><strong>48. $ copy dir1 dir2</strong> : copies the content of one directory to another directory. This command is usually used to backup the data. </p>
<ul><strong>F) Unix Security Commands</strong></ul>

<p><strong>49. $ passwd </strong> : used to change your password</p>
<p><strong>50. $ passwd -s </strong> : displays status about password like its length and expiry date.</p>
<p><strong>51. $ passwd -d</strong> : used to delete your password</p>
<p><strong>52. $ passwd -x 120 user1 </strong> : 120 is the minimum number of days up to when the password is valid for user1.</p>
<p><strong>53. # passwd -l bb7 </strong> : this command is used by super user to lock account of the user bb7.</p>

<p><strong>54. # passwd -u bb7 </strong> : this command is used by super user to unlock account of the user bb7.</p>
<ul><strong>G) Unix Command Grouping</strong></ul>
<p>Grouping of commands allow us to use more than one command at a time.</p>
<p><strong>55. $ cal ; date</strong> : it will show first calendar and then date</p>
<p><strong>56. $ ls file1 &#038;&#038; cat t* </strong> : if file1 exists then it will show the content of all files whose name begins with t otherwise the whole command will fail.</p>

<p><strong>57. $ ls file1 || cat t* </strong> : if file1 exists or not, it will show the content of all files whose name begins with t.</p>
<p><strong>58. $ cat file1 file2 > file3 </strong> : it wil concatenate the contents of the two files file1 and file2 and store it in file3. If file3 does not exists, it will create one and if it already exists, it will overwrite it. To avoid overwriting we can use <strong>$ cat file1 file2 >> file3 </strong>. It will not not overwrite the file3 but appends it.</p>
<p><strong>59. $ cat < file1 </strong> : cat will take the input from file2 and displays it.  </p>
<ul><strong>H) Unix Communication Commands</strong></ul>

<p></strong><strong>60. $ mesg y</strong> : enables your terminal to receive messages from other terminals.</p>
<p><strong>61. $ mesg n</strong> : disables your terminal to receive messages from other terminals.</p>
<p><strong>62. $ who -T</strong> : displays all the terminals who have enabled the write permission on their terminal. The + sign in front of the terminal no. will show you have the write permission on that terminal and - shows you have no write permission.</p>
<p><strong>63. $ who -TH</strong> : displays all the terminals who have enabled the write permission on their terminal. The + sign in front of the terminal no. will show you have the write permission on that terminal and - shows you have no write permission but in this case heading will appear on the top of each column.</p>
<p><strong>64. $ write bb8</strong> : enables you to write on the terminal bb8. Write this command and then type your message and then press CTRL + D. Your message will be sent to bb8.</p>

<p><strong>65. # wall</strong> : this command is used by superuser to make an announcement to all the users.</p>
<p><strong>66. # news</strong> : this command is used by superuser to deliver a news to all the users.</p>
<p><strong>67. # motd</strong> : this command is used by superuser to give message of the day to all the users.</p>
<p><strong>68. $ mail bb8</strong> : this command is used for sending mail to a user bb8.</p>
<p><strong>69. $ mail</strong> : this command will display all the mails you have received.</p>

<p><strong>70. $ reply bb8</strong> : this command is used for replying to the sender bb8.</p>
</ul>


Good List.  <a href="http://www.engineeringblog.indiabtech.com/2009/08/70-very-very-basic-unix-commands-you-must-know/">Thanks.</a>
]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>How to remove,install and reconfigure xorg without reinstalling ubuntu</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/how-to-removeinstall-and-reconfigure-xorg-without-reinstalling-ubuntu/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 28 Sep 2009 16:58:19 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Ubuntu]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ubuntu"><![CDATA[Ubuntu]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[X-Server]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="x-server"><![CDATA[X-Server]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Xorg]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="xorg"><![CDATA[Xorg]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=397</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[This tutorial will explain How to remove,install and reconfigure xorg, without reinstalling ubuntu this is very useful if you messup with your xorg file.</p>
<p>Open terminal and run these commands</p>
<p>Remove existing xorg using the following command</p>
<blockquote><p>sudo apt-get remove <code>--</code>purge xserver-xorg</p></blockquote>

<p>Install xorg using the following command</p>
<blockquote><p>sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg</p></blockquote>
<p>Reconfigure xorg using the following command</p>
<blockquote><p>sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg</p></blockquote>



<a href="http://www.ubuntugeek.com/ubuntu-tiphow-to-removeinstall-and-reconfigure-xorg-without-reinstalling-ubuntu.html">Thanks to</a>]]></content:encoded>

<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/CF3B15BD-DCFB-4F50-8883-BB00A517838A.jpg" alt="CF3B15BD-DCFB-4F50-8883-BB00A517838A.jpg" border="0" width="226" height="170" align="right" hspace = "20"/>Orange has reached an agreement to sell Apple's popular iPhone in the UK.

The deal ends an exclusive arrangement between UK network operator O2 and the Californian phone maker, which has been in place since 2007.

Orange said its customers would be able to buy the phone "later this year" but did not specify a date or pricing.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/9A6040B1-9DD3-4F89-9C11-CB6A2EC5111B.jpg" alt="9A6040B1-9DD3-4F89-9C11-CB6A2EC5111B.jpg" border="0" width="500" height="329" /></div>

Apple also noted over 85,000 applications are now available on the App Store. Currently, 125,000 developers are enrolled in Appleâ€™s iPhone Developer Program.]]></content:encoded>

<title>Vodafone to Sell iPhone in UK and Ireland Too....</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/vodafone-to-sell-iphone-in-uk-and-ireland-too/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 30 Sep 2009 11:23:07 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>
