<title>SME business websites let down by basic usability faults</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/sme-business-websites-let-down-by-basic-usability-faults/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 28 Oct 2009 10:47:32 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/10/sme-business-websites-let-down-by-basic-usability-faults/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="font-family: Tahoma; font-size: medium;"><h1><br /></h1><h2>83 per cent of online shoppers find faults on small business websites</h2><p></p><div><p>The vast majority of consumers who usedÂ <a target="_blank">small business</a>Â websites in the past year have discovered serious usability faults, according to new research fromÂ <a href="http://www.streamline.net/" title="Streamline.net" target="_blank">Streamline.net</a>, a provider of value web hosting.</p> <p>TheÂ <a href="http://Streamline.net/">Streamline.net</a>Â study questioned 1700 consumers, with 83 per cent of those users questioned saying they faced faults when shopping online with SME companies, including unfinished web pages, broken URLs andÂ <a target="_blank">email</a>Â addresses and an out-dated website design with stock images and badly worded product descriptions. 15 per cent also found confusing jargon, which made selecting products difficult.</p> <div><img />Â Â Â </div><p><img title="" border="0" alt="" />Â A further survey of 450 UK firms found that whilst most - 51 per cent - consider their website to look &#39;professional&#39;, 1 in 3 owners admitted that they are guilty of &#39;neglecting&#39; their own websites.Â  The data also highlights a worrying discrepancy between where consumers wish to find web addresses, and where companies are displaying them.Â </p> <p><a href="http://Streamline.net/">Streamline.net</a>Â discovered 48 per cent of firms questioned still do not make any efforts to optimise their URL on search engines like Google.Â </p><p>The company also found in the past year, 1 in 5 consumers have used a web address taken from the side of a small company&#39;s vehicle, yet only 10 per cent of small firms currently display their web address in this way.</p> <p>1 in 10 websites owners - 11 per cent - admitted to having withheld their URL from customers in the past because they were aware of technical problems on their website.Â </p><p>Established in 1999,Â <a href="http://Streamline.net/">Streamline.net</a>Â is a UK based value web hosting provider, a sister company toÂ <a href="http://www.fasthosts.co.uk/" title="Fasthosts" target="_blank">Fasthosts</a>.</p> <p><a href="http://Streamline.net/">Streamline.net</a>Â currently hosts over 150,000 websites.</p><p><br /></p><p><a href="http://www.macworld.co.uk/business/news/index.cfm?RSS&amp;NewsID=27402">Source</a></p> </div></div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/sme-business-websites-let-down-by-basic-usabi">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Create a Recent Applications Stack in the Dock</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/create-a-recent-applications-stack-in-the-dock/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 02 Nov 2009 18:21:54 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Dock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dock"><![CDATA[Dock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Finder]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="finder"><![CDATA[Finder]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=471</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ol>
<p><li> Launch Terminal, located at /Applications/Utilities/Terminal. </li></p>

<p><li> Enter the following text into Terminal. You can copy/paste the following line into Terminal, or you can simply type the line as shown. (The command below is a single line of text, but your browser may break it into multiple lines. Be sure to enter the text as a single line in the Terminal application. </li></p>

<blockquote class="yes">
defaults write com.apple.dock persistent-others -array-add '{ &quot;tile-data&quot; = { &quot;list-type&quot; = 1; }; &quot;tile-type&quot; = &quot;recents-tile&quot;; }'
</blockquote>

<p><li> After you enter the line above, press enter or return. </li></p>

<p><li> Enter the following text into Terminal. If you type the text rather than copy/paste it, be sure to match the case of the text. </li></p>

<blockquote class="yes">
killall Dock
</blockquote>

<p><li> Press enter or return. </li></p>

<p><li> The Dock will disappear for a moment and then reappear. </li></p>

<p><li> Enter the following text into Terminal. </li></p>

<blockquote class="yes">
exit
</blockquote>

<p><li> Press enter or return. </li></p>

<p><li> The exit command will cause Terminal to end the current session. You can then quit the Terminal application. </li></p>
</ol>

<h3> Using the Recent Items Stack </h3>

<p>Your Dock will now have a new Recent Items stack located just to the left of the Trash icon. If you click on the Recent Items stack, you will see a list of your most recently used applications. Click the Recent Items stack again to close the display of recent applications.</p>

<p>But wait; there&#146;s more. If you right-click on the Recent Items stack, you will see that you can choose which recent items should display. You can select any of the following from the menu: Recent Applications, Recent Documents, Recent Servers, Recent Volumes, or Favorite Items.</p>

<p>If you would like to have more than one Recent Items stack, repeat the terminal commands listed above under &#145;Let&#146;s Get Started.&#146; This will create a second Recent Items stack, which you can right-click and assign to show one of the recent item types. For instance, you could have two Recent Item stacks; one showing recent applications and the other showing recent documents.</p>

<h3> Deleting the Recent Items Stack </h3>

<p>If you decide you don&#146;t wish to have a Recent Items stack in your Dock, you can make it disappear by right-clicking on the stack and selecting &#145;Remove from Dock&#146; from the pop-up menu. This will remove the Recent Items stack and return your Dock to the way it looked before you added the Recent Items stack.</p>


]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<title>Brush Your iPhone&#039;s Bezel to Hide Scuffs and Scratches [IPhone]</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/brush-your-iphones-bezel-to-hide-scuffs-and-scratches-iphone/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 04 Nov 2009 16:48:01 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/brush-your-iphones-bezel-to-hide-scuffs-and-scratches-iphone/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Great tips here:<p />  <p /> <p /> <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/lifehacker/full/~3/SKvUFSdOS7M/brush-your-iphones-bezel-to-hide-scuffs-and-scratches">Brush Your iPhone&#39;s Bezel to Hide Scuffs and Scratches [IPhone]</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://lifehacker.com" class="f">Lifehacker</a> by Kevin Purdy on 11/3/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <p><img src="http://cache.gawker.com/assets/images/lifehacker/2009/11/brushed_iphone.jpg" width="340" />If the shiny metal bezel around your iPhone has seen better days, and that nags at your perfectionist instincts, a quick protective taping and smooth back-and-forth with a rough-sided sponge can give it a more consistent, brushed look.</p> <p>As detailed by a YouTube user and tested by the Just Another iPhone blog, brushing your iPhone's shiny bezel gives the phone a different look, along with helping to hide fingerprints, scratches, and chips acquired during rough travel. The key is taking long, smooth strokes with the coarse side of a sponge (they're usually yellow with green scrubbing surfaces), and being sure to protectively tape the edges of the bezel, and especially the screen, from your handiwork.</p> <p> <embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/NtLSeVx_q1I&amp;hl=en&amp;fs=1&amp;fmt=22" for closer looks at what the finished product looks like, and drop your own iPhone (or other smartphone) physical fixes in the comments.</p> <div><a href="http://justanotheriphoneblog.com/wordpress/iphone-modding/10-minute-project-giving-your-iphone-bezel-a-brushed-look">10 minute project: giving your iPhone bezel a brushed look</a> [Just Another iPhone Blog]</div> <p />  <a href="http://ads.pheedo.com/click.phdo?s=67a388c8b7655fe6946c24da7024b29b&amp;p=1"><img src="http://ads.pheedo.com/img.phdo?s=67a388c8b7655fe6946c24da7024b29b&amp;p=1" marginwidth="0" frameborder="0" height="280" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" width="100%"></iframe></p><div> <a <title>Orange UK Unlimited Plan for iPhone Seems to Prohibit Almost 	Everything</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/orange-uk-unlimited-plan-for-iphone-seems-to-prohibit-almost-everything/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 04 Nov 2009 19:43:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/orange-uk-unlimited-plan-for-iphone-seems-to-prohibit-almost-everything/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is interesting.<p />I was looking forward to jumping from O2 to Orange (once my contact has expired in about 47 years)<p />But Orange is looking less and less attractive...<p />  <p /> <p /> <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/TheAppleBlog/~3/UlwuzOWQGSE/">Orange UK Unlimited Plan for iPhone Seems to Prohibit Almost Everything</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://theappleblog.com" class="f">TheAppleBlog</a> by Darrell Etherington on 11/3/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <div><br /><p><img title="orange-logo" src="http://gigapple.files.wordpress.com/2009/09/orange-logo.jpg?w=183&amp;h=184" height="184" alt="orange-logo" width="183" /></p> <p>The BBC <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/technology/2009/11/oranges_unlimited_iphone.html">noticed something a little off</a> when it investigated the new pricing structure and terms of use for the iPhone deals Orange is about to begin offering on Nov. 10. First, it turns out that far from sparking a price war, Orange has basically adopted the same deal that O2 currently offers, with some minor changes meant to sway customers its way.</p> <p>Secondly, and this is the real kicker, Orangeâ€™s â€œunlimitedâ€ apparently means up to a maximum of 750MB per month, if you look at the fine print. When asked to clarify, Orange stated that the cap was for its 3G network, and that another 750MB cap existed for use at the hotspots of its Wi-Fi partner BT Openzone. Finally, another clause in the Orange Terms and Conditions states that data isâ€¦</p> <blockquote class="posterous_medium_quote"><p>Not to be used for other activities (e.g., using your handset as a modem, non-Orange Internet-based streaming services, voice or video over the internet, instant messaging, peer-to-peer file sharing, non-Orange Internet-based video). Should such use be detected notice may be given and network protection controls applied to all services which Orange does not believe constitutes mobile browsing.</p></blockquote> <p><span></span><br /> I donâ€™t know about you, but Iâ€™m pretty certain I do almost all of those things on my iPhone over my carrierâ€™s data connection on at least a daily basis. If true, this clause could block the use of programs like Beejive IM, Facebook, Spotify, and the BBC iPlayer.</p> <p>By contrast, O2, when asked to clarify its fair use limits, said this:</p> <blockquote class="posterous_medium_quote"><p>We reserve the rightâ€¦to contact customers about their usage if we believe it adversely affects the service of our other customers, e.g., if a customer uses their SIM in another device for which it is not intended.</p></blockquote> <p>So what advantage is left to Orange, then? Basically only network coverage and quality. This just goes to show that the iPhone is a cruel mistress no matter which carrier she appears on, and that the end of exclusivity might have less positive ramifications for customers than previously expected.</p> <p>Data is the key to the iPhoneâ€™s success, as it is positioned as one of the few devices on the market that users increasingly use for Internet access first, and phone functionality second. This <a href="http://pro.gigaom.com/2009/09/mobile-broadband-pricing-for-profits/">presents a dilemma</a> (subscription required) for wireless operators, since keeping up with demand can considerably tax network quality and dependability. AT&amp;T in the U.S. is <a href="http://gigaom.com/2009/09/25/will-atts-network-hold-up-under-the-mms-strain/">constantly under fire</a> for its 3G network stability, for example.</p> <p>Orange later said it would be reviewing the cap following the large volume of negative emails it received regarding its use of the word â€œunlimited.â€ Hopefully, the company will also look at those ridiculous restrictions regarding data usage, since the real appeal of the iPhone for most users is the ability to do precisely those things which that clause specifically prohibits.</p> <a href="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/gocomments/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/comments/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" border="0" alt="" /></a> <a href="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/godelicious/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/delicious/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" border="0" alt="" /></a> <a href="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/godigg/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://feeds.wordpress.com/1.0/digg/gigapple.wordpress.com/35205/" border="0" alt="" border="0" /></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/TheAppleBlog?a=UlwuzOWQGSE:BTZlwtBuFd4:F7zBnMyn0Lo"><img App Store users have downloaded well over two billion apps, continuing to make it the worldâ€™s most popular applications store.</div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/over-100000-apps-now-available-on-the-app-sto-0">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Restrictive laws wall off hemp bricks</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/restrictive-laws-wall-off-hemp-bricks/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 06 Nov 2009 17:32:20 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/restrictive-laws-wall-off-hemp-bricks/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[I never knew hemp was so usefull...<p />  <p /> <p /> <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://www.supereco.com/news/2009/11/05/restrictive-laws-wall-off-hemp-bricks/">Restrictive laws wall off hemp bricks</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://www.supereco.com/" class="f">Super Eco News Feed</a> by Lisa Poisso on 11/5/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <img src="http://media.supereco.com/media/2009/11/05/320w/hemp-plants.jpg" border="0" align="right" /> <p>Assess for us, if you would, the qualities of this sustainable construction material:</p><ul><li>Bio-negative manufacturing (more carbon dioxide is locked up in the process of growing and harvesting the component materials than is released during the production of the binding ingredient)</li><li>100% recyclable (can be used as fertilizer after being demolished)</li><li>Waterproof</li><li>Fireproof</li><li>Insulates well</li><li>Does not rot when used above ground</li></ul><p>What is this mysterious construction material, and why isn't it in <em>your</em> home? The material is <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/hemp/">hemp</a>, and it's not used in the United States because of laws prohibiting growing of so-called industrial hemp. <a href="http://www.lhoist.co.uk/tradical/hemp-lime.html">Hemcrete</a> bricks, made from hemp, lime and water, have been used in Europe for years now. Growing hempâ€”even low-THC varieties specifically raised for food, fiber and industrial useâ€”is illegal in all but a handful of states in America, making construction with <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/sustainable/">sustainable</a> hemp bricks prohibitively expensive. Figures from the <a href="http://www.thehia.org/">Hemp Industries Association</a> show that virtually 100 percent of the hemp used in American hemp products last yearâ€”products worth approximately $360 million in retail valueâ€”were imported.</p><p>Progress toward legalizing industrial hemp farming in the United States is crawling. Oregon recently became the ninth state to remove legal barriers to industrial hemp farming. Reports <a href="http://stopthedrugwar.org/chronicle/597/oregon_passes_hemp_cultivation_bill">StoptheDrugWar.org</a>:</p><blockquote><p><em>Hemp is a member of the cannabis family, but is distinguished from smokeable marijuana by its low THC content and its lanky, fibrous appearance. The Oregon law specifies that industrial hemp must contain less than 0.3% THC. So does pending federal legislation, <a href="http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/z?c111:H.R.1866:">HR 1866</a>, sponsored by Rep. Ron Paul (R-TX), which would remove low-THC hemp from the Controlled Substances Act and thus the DEA's domain. The eight other states that have removed barriers to hemp production or research are Hawaii, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Montana, North Dakota, Vermont and West Virginia. Oregon joins North Dakota as the only states that do not require farmers to obtain federal permits from the DEA to grow hemp.</em></p></blockquote> <p></p> <p>(Photo credit:<a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/tusnelda/3603789581/" title="storebukkebruse, flickr">storebukkebruse, flickr</a>)</p> 	<div> 		 		 		<dt>Glossary:</dt> <dd> 		 <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/hemp/">Hemp</a>, 	 		 <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/sustainable/">Sustainable</a>, 	 		 <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/carbon-footprint/">Carbon footprint</a>, 	 		 <a href="http://www.supereco.com/glossary/recycling/">Recycling</a> 	 </dd> <span></span>  		 	</div></div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/restrictive-laws-wall-off-hemp-bricks">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<title>Samsung Introduces 0.6mm-Thick Flash Chips for Mobile Devices</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/samsung-introduces-0-6mm-thick-flash-chips-for-mobile-devices/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 09 Nov 2009 14:00:19 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/samsung-introduces-0-6mm-thick-flash-chips-for-mobile-devices/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div><br /><h4>Sent to you via Google Reader</h4><h2><a href="http://www.maximumpc.com/article/news/samsung_introduces_06mmthick_flash_chips_mobile_devices">Samsung Introduces 0.6mm-Thick Flash Chips for Mobile Devices</a></h2><p>Samsung has announced a new breakthrough that could lead to&nbsp; mobile devices with greater storage space than before. The company says it has <a href="http://www.informationweek.com/news/hardware/processors/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=221600353&amp;cid=RSSfeed_IWK_All" target="_blank">developed a new multi-chip memory package that is 40% thinner and lighter than a normal memory package.</a> The 0.6mm-thick package is said to contain eight 30-nanometer NAND Flash chips.</p><br /><p>The new package owes its lean figure to a â€œbareâ€ die that is just half as thick as a conventional die. The ultra-thin package contains a â€œbareâ€ die that is only 15 micrometers thick. This is quite an achievement on Samsungâ€™s part as it has managed to overcome â€œthe conventional technology limits of a chip's resistance to external pressure when under 30um in height.â€ Chips based on this new technology seem tailor-made for SSDs and mobile devices.</p><br /><div style="text-align: center;"><img src="http://www.maximumpc.com/files/u46168/samsung_mcp.jpg" height="236" width="405" /></div><br /><p><em>Image Credit: Samsung </em></p></div><div></div><div><p />Sent from my iPhone</div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/samsung-introduces-06mm-thick-flash-chips-for">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>

<title>Let there be light, with Beamer</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/let-there-be-light-with-beamer/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 09 Nov 2009 16:59:26 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/let-there-be-light-with-beamer/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[  <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://www.iphoneography.com/journal/2009/11/8/let-there-be-light-with-beamer.html">Let there be light, with Beamer</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://www.iphoneography.com/journal/" class="f">The iPhoneography Blog</a> by Glyn Evans on 11/8/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <p style="text-align: justify;"><span><span><img src="http://www.iphoneography.com/storage/beamer_1_081109.jpg?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1257704575880" alt="" /></span></span></p> <p style="text-align: justify;">Beamer is an iPhone case with a built-in LED light you can turn on to use as both a light and a camera light.<p />It is a hard-plastic, two-piece design, equipped with a replaceable coin cell battery that provides about 10 hours of illumination. Pressing the button once will turn the light on for 10 seconds, pressing it twice will leave it on indefinitely, and a third press will turn the light off.</p> <p style="text-align: justify;"><span><span><img src="http://www.iphoneography.com/storage/beamer_2_081109.jpg?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1257704617168" alt="" /></span></span>The Beamer will be available in a range of colours, and is currently available for pre-order priced at $32 USD.<p />I am not sure how effective this case/light will be, but for more information or to pre-order it then head over to the <a href="http://www.quirky.com/products/18-Beamer">developers website.</a></p></div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/let-there-be-light-with-beamer">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>

<title>Update Fans: Mac OS X Update 10.6.2 is out</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/update-fans-mac-os-x-update-10-6-2-is-out/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 10 Nov 2009 17:36:36 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=480</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[And only 157.7MB

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/Screen-shot-2009-11-10-at-15.09.15.png" alt="Screen shot 2009-11-10 at 15.09.15.png" border="0" width="507" height="620" /></div>

Release notes:

The 10.6.2 Update is recommended for all users running Mac OS X Snow Leopard and includes general operating system fixes that enhance the stability, compatibility, and security of your Mac, including fixes for:
an issue that might cause your system to logout unexpectedly
a graphics distortion in Safari Top Sites
Spotlight search results not showing Exchange contacts
a problem that prevented authenticating as an administrative user
issues when using NTFS and WebDAV file servers
the reliability of menu extras
an issue with the 4-finger swipe gesture
an issue that causes Mail to quit unexpectedly when setting up an Exchange server
Address Book becoming unresponsive when editing
a problem adding images to contacts in Address Book
an issue that prevented opening files downloaded from the Internet
Safari plug-in reliability
general reliability improvements for iWork, iLife, Aperture, Final Cut Studio, MobileMe, and iDisk
an issue that caused data to be deleted when using a guest account
For detailed information on this update, please visit this website: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3874.
For information on the security content of this update, please visit: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222.


And the big news: Intel Atom support officially missing from Mac OS X 10.6.2]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Dock Placement</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/dock-placement/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 10 Nov 2009 19:52:13 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Dock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dock"><![CDATA[Dock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=482</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[You can change the dock location with no additional software, using the built-in defaults command line tool. 

Launch Terminal.app and enter any of these commands:

defaults write com.apple.dock orientation left
defaults write com.apple.dock orientation right
defaults write com.apple.dock orientation top
defaults write com.apple.dock orientation bottom
defaults write com.apple.dock pinning start
defaults write com.apple.dock pinning center
defaults write com.apple.dock pinning end

Then restart the Dock

sudo killall Dock

Have fun...

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/Screen-shot-2009-11-10-at-19.52.43.png" alt="Screen shot 2009-11-10 at 19.52.43.png" border="0" width="500" height="313" /></div>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Survey: IT Admins Split on Server vs Cloud Computing</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/survey-it-admins-split-on-server-vs-cloud-computing/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 17 Nov 2009 11:59:16 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/survey-it-admins-split-on-server-vs-cloud-computing/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[  <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://www.maximumpc.com/article/maximum_it/survey_it_admins_split_server_vs_cloud_computing">Survey: IT Admins Split on Server vs Cloud Computing</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://www.maximumpc.com/articles/all" class="f">Maximum PC all RSS Feed</a> by Paul Lilly on 11/16/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <p>Ready for a shocker? Rackspace Hosting, a company which rents server space, <a href="http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/11/15/rackspace_no_more_servers/">surveyed </a>441 U.S. and U.K.-based IT decision makers at companies with anywhere between 100 to 500 employees and found that just over half of them -- 51 percent -- &quot;would love to never have to buy another server again.&quot;</p> <p>Rackspace's spin on the survey suggests that the time and money enterprises currently allocate to managing in-house servers would be better spent on increasing strategic initiatives within the company. This, of course, would require a shift to cloud computing services, such as those offered by Rackspace. </p> <p>The survey also found that &quot;on-site servers are causing stress for IT decision makers,&quot; with hardware issues and maintenance, after hours issues, and 24/7 availability listed as the main challenges.</p> <p>But while Rackspace sees the data as overwhelmingly positive in favor of cloud computing, another way to look at it is that nearly half of IT admins remain skittish about off-site services. And understandably so, given the early-adoptance aspect and high profile data scares, like the <a href="http://www.maximumpc.com/article/news/sidekick_data_flub_could_be_bad_news_microsoft">recent glitch</a> that caused T-Mobile Sidekick owners to lose their contacts. </p> <p><a href="http://www.rackspace.com/downloads/surveys/NoMoreServersSurvey.pdf">Survey Details (PDF) </a></p> <p align="center"><img src="http://www.maximumpc.com/files/u69/Cloud_Building.jpg" height="281" width="405" /></p> <p><span style="font-size: xx-small;">Image Credit: lonewolflibrarian.wordpress.com </span></p></div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/survey-it-admins-split-on-server-vs-cloud-com">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>487</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2009-11-17 12:59:16</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-11-17 11:59:16</wp:post_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
<wp:post_name>survey-it-admins-split-on-server-vs-cloud-computing</wp:post_name>

<item>
<title>New iPhone Photo App: AutoCam</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/new-iphone-photo-app-autocam/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 19 Nov 2009 20:59:08 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/11/new-iphone-photo-app-autocam/</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[  <div style="font-family: sans-serif; overflow: auto; margin: 0px 10px;"><h2 style="margin: 0.25em 0 0 0;" /><div class=""><a href="http://www.iphoneography.com/journal/2009/11/18/new-iphone-photo-app-autocam.html">New iPhone Photo App: AutoCam</a></div></h2> <div style="margin-bottom: 0.5em;">via <a href="http://www.iphoneography.com/journal/" class="f">The iPhoneography Blog</a> by Glyn Evans on 11/18/09</div><br style="display: none;" /> <p style="text-align: justify;"><span><span><img src="http://www.iphoneography.com/storage/AutoCamLogo.png?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1258497001947" alt="" /></span></span><strong>Description from the AppStore:</strong> AutoCam is an iPhone App which turns your iPhone into an automatic photo camera taking series of pictures and storing them into your Camera Roll or uploading them to your PicasaWeb Albums!<p />There are lots of cases where you can use AutoCam:</p> <ul style="text-align: justify;"> <li><span><span><img src="http://www.iphoneography.com/storage/AutoCam_1_171109.gif?__SQUARESPACE_CACHEVERSION=1258497046880" alt="" /></span></span>Do you want to know who steals your cookies? Hide your iPhone somewhere in the office, start AutoCam and the thief wonâ€™t have a chance.</li> <li>Do you want to make a time lapse movie of a growing bamboo or of the clouds behind your window and need pictures for this? Not a problem anymore.</li> <li>Or maybe you want to place your iPhone on the panel of your car to make automatic road pictures of your trip and to store them automatically to PicasaWeb for your friends?</li> <li>You also can use now your iPhone to take pictures of birds in your garden. Place the iPhone near a nest box and get pictures youâ€™ll never get without a telephoto lens and an expensive camera!</li> <li>Do you want to take photos of the environment without pointing the camera on strange people? Just start AutoCam and simulate a phone call!</li> <li>With AutoCam your iPhone is also a web cam!</li> </ul> <p style="text-align: justify;">AutoCam is very easy to use. Choose a shooting interval between 10 seconds and 1 hour, select the duration of the shooting and enable the spy mode! Optionally, you also can input your login information for Google PicasaWeb and all photos will be uploaded to the Drop Box album in PicasaWeb. <p /><a href="http://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/autocam/id338469805?mt=8">AppStore Link: AutoCam - Price Â£1.19/$1.99</a></p></div>      <p style="font-size: 10px;">  <a href="http://posterous.com">Posted via email</a>   from <a href="http://danielhpavey.posterous.com/new-iphone-photo-app-autocam">Daniel's posterous</a>  </p>  ]]></content:encoded>

<title>Java for Mac OS X 10.6 Update 1</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/java-for-mac-os-x-10-6-update-1/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 04 Dec 2009 10:42:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[Java for Mac OS X 10.6 Update 1 delivers improved compatibility, security, and reliability by updating Java SE 6 to 1.6.0_17.

Please quit and relaunch any web browsers and Java applications after installing this update.

For more details on this update, please visit this website: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3892

For information on the security content of this update, please visit this website: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/12/Screen-shot-2009-12-04-at-10.42.04.png" alt="Screen shot 2009-12-04 at 10.42.04.png" border="0" width="512" height="620" /></div>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Amazon Kindle app hits UK iPhone &#124; News &#124; PC Pro</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/amazon-kindle-app-hits-uk-iphone-news-pc-pro/</link>

<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><a href="http://www.pcpro.co.uk/news/354103/amazon-kindle-app-hits-uk-iphone">Amazon Kindle app hits UK iPhone | News | PC Pro</a>: "Amazon Kindle app hits UK iPhone
iPhone 3GS
 
Gallery

Posted on 14 Dec 2009 at 10:25

Amazon has launched its iPhone Kindle app in the UK.

The app, which allows readers to purchase eBooks from the Kindle store and read them on their iPhone, has been available in the US since March.

The free app allows users to synch bookmarks and notes between their iPhone, Kindle and PC software. It will also remember the last page you read, allowing you to pick up reading on the iPhone where you left off on the Kindle.

The app further brings the ability to read previews of books, and alter font sizes and vary the number of words displayed per line. Amazon's also touting the fact that, unlike the Kindle, magazines and books can be displayed in colour.

Amazon claims it is currently working on software for the Mac and an app for the BlackBerry.

'The Kindle for iPhone App is the perfect companion for customers who own a Kindle or Kindle DX, and a great way for customers around the world to download and read books even if they donâ€™t yet have a Kindle,' says Ian Freed, vice president for Amazon Kindle."</p>

<p>(Via <a href=""></a>.)</p>]]></content:encoded>

I never got further than downloading the software, and on the basis of this article I don't feel that I've missed out too much...

My favourite quote about some of the changes that have occurred recently is:

<blockquote>"Itâ€™s a strange world where searching for â€œbettingâ€ is banned, and yet â€œrapeâ€ returns a string of results. "</blockquote>

Nice ! !

<title>UK&#039;s Wi-Fi boom fueled by iPhone</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/uks-wi-fi-boom-fueled-by-iphone/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 06 Jan 2010 16:47:48 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=512</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.macworld.com/article/145391/2010/01/uk_wifi.html?lsrc=rss_main">UK's Wi-Fi boom fueled by iPhone</a>: 

"The UK is set for a Wi-Fi boom, with the number of Wi-Fi Internet hotspots trebling treble over the next two years to cope with demand from users of Apple's iPhone.

BT, which has 4,000 public hotspots across the UK, a doubling of traffic in 2009. It expects customers to be using close to 1 billion minutes of wi-fi on its networks in the year to March 2010.

The FT estimates that global Wi-Fi usage increased by 47 percent in 2009, with about 245,000 hotspots located around the world, according to In-Stat, the market research company."


<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/208D1339-56FC-4A81-AC0A-FC91743A914D.jpg" alt="208D1339-56FC-4A81-AC0A-FC91743A914D.jpg" border="0" width="500" /></div>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Bono is a plonker too shock...</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/bono-is-a-plonker-too-shock/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 06 Jan 2010 20:54:03 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Bono]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="bono"><![CDATA[Bono]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dontdisconnect.us]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dontdisconnect-us"><![CDATA[dontdisconnect.us]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[File Sharing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="file-sharing"><![CDATA[File Sharing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ISP]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="isp"><![CDATA[ISP]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Talk Talk]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="talk-talk"><![CDATA[Talk Talk]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=517</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/D5E3AE5A-6E25-4667-AD4A-B8F3AB6BBFB5.jpg" alt="D5E3AE5A-6E25-4667-AD4A-B8F3AB6BBFB5.jpg" border="0" width="200" align="left" hspace = "10" />

Oh dear, Bono has now joined the list of musicians I used to respect until they started banging on about illegal file sharers....

Writing for the New York Times, Bono claimed internet service providers were "reverse Robin Hoods" benefiting from the music industry's lost profits.

He hinted that China's efforts prove that tracking net content is possible. 

Err Bono and China are now best buddies...! ! !

So the multi, multi, multi millionaire Bono joins a list that includes the very rich Lilly Allen & Matt Bellamy, bleating on about lost revenue to file sharers.

This despite some <a href="http://news.cnet.com/8301-17852_3-10387976-71.html">recent research</a> which shows that "those who share files spend 75 percent more on music than those who have allegedly clean hands"

I would also like to remind Bono et al that the record industry has for some been forcing us to pay large sums of money for little round bits of plastic which we all know costs pennies to manufacture.

In fact some of there actions make the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luddite">Luddites</a> look like laid back hippies...

Maybe it's payback time for these extraordinarily profitable businesses?

Or maybe the world is changing and like the Luddites, Bone and his fantastically rich friends and business associates may have to change too....

Help these people understand and check out <a href="http://www.dontdisconnect.us/">dontdisconnect.us</a>


]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>USB 3 Western Digital My Book  Announced </title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/usb-3-western-digital-my-book-announced/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 07 Jan 2010 09:27:22 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[External Hardrive]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="external-hardrive"><![CDATA[External Hardrive]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hard-drives"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="storage"><![CDATA[Storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="western-digital"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=527</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/8AA36140-76D3-45C7-872F-0E518E3B8200.jpg" alt="8AA36140-76D3-45C7-872F-0E518E3B8200.jpg" border="0" width="92" height="275" align="right" />

Western Digital have announced the new My Book 3.0 series as <a href="http://www.cesweb.org/">CES</a>

The 1TB version of the SuperSpeed drive is available now with a USB 3.0 adapter card, and a 2TB version will hit next week.

All my external USB drives are from Western Digital and all perform well and have been completely reliable.

If you need a new external drive and want to be future proofed one of these babies could be just the thing (USB 3 is backwards compatible)

Or just get one anyway so you can have more mysterious black boxes on your desk...

]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Google Release the Nexus One</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/google-release-the-nexus-one/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 07 Jan 2010 09:59:00 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mobile Broadband]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mobile-broadband"><![CDATA[Mobile Broadband]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mobiles]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mobiles"><![CDATA[Mobiles]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Nexus One]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="nexus-one"><![CDATA[Nexus One]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Phones]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="phones"><![CDATA[Phones]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=530</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Google has confirmed the release of the Nexus One.

The web has been bursting with rumours about this device and its possible specs for some time, but now Google have finally confirmed the details.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Screen-shot-2010-01-07-at-09.48.31.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-01-07 at 09.48.31.png" border="0" width="276" height="536" /></div>

The key highlights are:
<ul>
<li>3.7-inch AMOLED display</li>
<li>1GHz Snapdragon processor</li>
<li>Compass</li>
<li>GPS</li>
<li>Accelerometer</li>
<li>Light and proximity sensor</li>
<li>5 megapixel camera with LED flash</li>
<li>3.5mm headphone jack</li>
<li>Multicolored LED under the trackball</li>
</ul>

You can immerse yourself in its full glory <a href="http://www.google.com/phone">here</a> including a 3D tour !

It is available in the UK without a contract for $529



]]></content:encoded>

<blockquote>â€œThree billion applications downloaded in less than 18 months â€” this is like nothing weâ€™ve ever seen beforeâ€¦The revolutionary App Store offers iPhone and iPod touch users an experience unlike anything else available on other mobile devices, and we see no signs of the competition catching up anytime soon.â€</blockquote>

<item>
<title>Microsoft beats Apple in unveiling &#039;slate PC&#039;. Everyone at Apple shrugs and smirks</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/microsoft-beats-apple-in-unveiling-slate-pc-everyone-at-apple-shrugs-and-smirks/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 07 Jan 2010 17:44:58 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iSlate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="islate"><![CDATA[iSlate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Slate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="slate"><![CDATA[Slate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tablet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tablet"><![CDATA[Tablet]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=541</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/D427CF48-CE29-4091-92C7-20A2ADD0C086.jpg" alt="D427CF48-CE29-4091-92C7-20A2ADD0C086.jpg" border="0" width="470" height="313" /></div>

Of course I am just guessing, but I'm also guessing that this Window driven "slate PC" will not be a patch on the rumoured <a href="http://www.wired.com/gadgetlab/2009/12/iguide-islate/">iSlate</a> touchscreen tablet device that Apple may or may not be announcing later this month.

This video is very very low on content:

<object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/IIIjTDnX2Y0&color1=0xb1b1b1&color2=0xcfcfcf&hl=en_US&feature=player_embedded&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/IIIjTDnX2Y0&color1=0xb1b1b1&color2=0xcfcfcf&hl=en_US&feature=player_embedded&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" width="425" height="344"></embed></object>

Although I like the fact that <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Ballmer">Ballmer</a> (Microsoft CEO) demonstrated the device running the Amazon Kindle desktop application with the hit book "Twilight" by Stephanie Meyer. The cover of the book ironically shows a pair of hands cradling an apple.

Nice touch....

But if the iSlate does materialise and if it's half as good as an iPhone, I'm sure it will wipe the floor with this offering from HP.]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>AirStash wireless SD card reader - the perfect accessory</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/airstash-wireless-sd-card-reader-the-perfect-accessory/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 11 Jan 2010 20:57:28 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Accessories]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="accessories"><![CDATA[Accessories]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[SD]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sd"><![CDATA[SD]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="storage"><![CDATA[Storage]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=544</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/34B95BAB-3E5B-4C78-9355-6920856D3838.jpg" alt="34B95BAB-3E5B-4C78-9355-6920856D3838.jpg" border="0" width="500" /></div>


This potentially great device has popped up towards the end of <a href="">CES</a>.

The AirStash is a wireless SD card reader, which is targeted at iPhone OS devices (but does work with other WiFi-enabled devices) and supports up to 32GB SDHC cards.

For wireless connection the AirStash acts as a WiFi 802.11b/g access point and is accessed via a browser

No price, release date or battery life available yet, but this looks like a great idea for all us storage starved iPhone users...

]]></content:encoded>

<title>BBC News - German government warns against using MS Explorer</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/bbc-news-german-government-warns-against-using-ms-explorer/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 17 Jan 2010 10:02:56 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[BBC]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="bbc"><![CDATA[BBC]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=568</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8463516.stm">BBC News - German government warns against using MS Explorer</a>: "German government warns against using MS Explorer

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/14C98BBB-6F3B-4EC7-A862-A4A3A2617864.jpg" alt="14C98BBB-6F3B-4EC7-A862-A4A3A2617864.jpg" border="0" width="226" height="170" align="right" />The warning applies to versions 6, 7 and 8 of Internet Explorer
The German government has warned web users to find an alternative browser to Internet Explorer to protect security.

The warning from the Federal Office for Information Security comes after Microsoft admitted IE was the weak link in recent attacks on Google's systems.

Microsoft rejected the warning, saying that the risk to users was low and that the browsers' increased security setting would prevent any serious risk."</p>

]]></content:encoded>

<title>The Beatles In 1957</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/the-beatles-in-1957/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 17 Jan 2010 10:20:42 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/364AA5F0-8CF7-4E09-BE45-3618A9A721A8.jpg" alt="364AA5F0-8CF7-4E09-BE45-3618A9A721A8.jpg" border="0" width="500" /></div>

The Beatles in 1957. George Harrison is 14, John Lennon is 16, and Paul McCartney is 15.

I love old pictures and this one is a doozy...

Where did <a href="http://all-thats-interesting.tumblr.com/post/338207167/the-beatles-in-1957">these guys </a>get it from....]]></content:encoded>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=576</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[You might know that you can right-click on a highlighted word and bring up the OS X dictionary on your  <a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/redirect.html?ie=UTF8&location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.co.uk%2Fs%3Fie%3DUTF8%26node%3D14014431%26ref_%3Damb%255Flink%255F55302465%255F3%26keywords%3DApple%26brand%3DApple&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=ur2&camp=1634&creative=19450"> Apple </a><img src="https://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=ur2&o=2" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" />computer.

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Screen-shot-2010-01-18-at-20.09.02.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-01-18 at 20.09.02.png" border="0" width="222" height="283" align="center" />


But did you know that you can press <strong>Command+Control+D</strong> while hovering over any word, and up pops the definition almost immediately. 
<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Screen-shot-2010-01-18-at-20.11.48.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-01-18 at 20.11.48.png" border="0" width="463" height="175" /></div>

If you continue to hold down those keys you can slide your mouse over any other word and get a definition as well. Let go of the keys, and click somewhere else and the dictionary vanishes.

Unfortunately this little feature doesn't work everywhere. It requires you be in a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocoa_(API)">Cocoa application</a>

My <del>spoulling</del> spelling is often atrocious so this kind of quick tip is a real winner, and another reason to love my Macbook...

<script type="text/javascript">
var uri = 'http://impgb.tradedoubler.com/imp?type(img)g(16408166)a(1762629)' + new String (Math.random()).substring (2, 11);
document.write('<a href="http://clkuk.tradedoubler.com/click?p=18461&a=1762629&g=16408166" target="_BLANK"><img src="'+uri+'" border=0></a>');
</script> ]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Google Chrome for Mac - Testing</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/google-chrome-for-mac-testing/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 19 Jan 2010 10:29:49 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Browsers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="browsers"><![CDATA[Browsers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="chrome"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mac"><![CDATA[Mac]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Test]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="test"><![CDATA[Test]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Testing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="testing"><![CDATA[Testing]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=578</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/12/37C79122-9CD3-454E-A1B9-734AE58613AA.jpg" alt="37C79122-9CD3-454E-A1B9-734AE58613AA.jpg" border="0" width="440" /></div>

I've finally forced myself to spend some proper time using and testing <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/12/its-finally-here-google-chrome-for-mac-available-today-in-beta/">Google's Chrome</a> internet browser on my Macbook.

I must say I'm quite impressed...

Boy is it <strong>fast</strong>, and not just to load pages, but the whole app launching takes a fraction of the time of my regular browser, <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2010/01/firefox-3-5-6-is-out-of-the-box/">Firefox</a>.

My biggest positive however is memory usage.  

Those of you who end up with ten or twenty tabs open will, like me, probably notice your machines memory getting filled up, and also the processor can start to churn a lot, presumably trying to manage all the memory usage !

However one of Chrome's much vaunted features is that every tab runs as its own process.

This is not something you really appreciate until you start using the browser for a while, but pretty soon you can appreciate how this helps keep the memory and processor footprint of the browser down to a minimum.

Obviously the Firefox plugins that you may have installed are not available for Chrome, however the only one I'm truly missing is <a href="http://agilewebsolutions.com/products/1Password">1Password</a> which is kind of an essential in my day to day life.  

So it's not quite goodbye to trusty Firefox yet...


]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Firefox 3.6 Launched</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/firefox-3-6-launched/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 23 Jan 2010 11:21:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Firefox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="firefox"><![CDATA[Firefox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Firefox 3.6]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="firefox-3-6"><![CDATA[Firefox 3.6]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Mozilla]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="mozilla"><![CDATA[Mozilla]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software-release"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=589</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.mozilla-europe.org/en/firefox/"><div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Screen-shot-2010-01-23-at-11.19.26.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-01-23 at 11.19.26.png" border="0" width="500" /></div></a>

Firefox 3.6 is out of the bag...

Main features in the new verions are:

        <ul class="spaced">
          <li>Available in more than 70 languages - get your <a href="http://www.mozilla.com/firefox/all.html" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >local version</a>.</li>
          <li>Support for a new type of theme called <a href="http://www.getpersonas.com/" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >Personas</a>, which allow users to change Firefox's appearance with a single click.</li>
          <li>Protection from <a href="http://theunfocused.net/2009/10/06/firefox-3-6-knows-when-your-plugins-are-out-of-date/" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >out-of-date plugins</a> to keep users safer as they browse.</li>

          <li>Open, native video can now be displayed <a href="http://mozillalinks.org/wp/2009/10/firefox-3-6-gets-full-screen-native-video/" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >full screen</a> and supports <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/En/HTML/Element/Video" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >poster frames</a>.</li>
          <li>Improved JavaScript performance, overall browser responsiveness, and startup time.</li>
          <li>The ability for web developers to indicate that <a href="https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=503481" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >scripts should run asynchronously</a> to speed up page load times.</li>

          <li>Continued support for downloadable web fonts using the new <a href="http://hacks.mozilla.org/2009/10/woff/" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >WOFF font format</a>.</li>
          <li>Support for new CSS attributes such as gradients, background sizing, and pointer events.</li>
          <li>Support for new DOM and HTML5 specifications including the Drag &amp; Drop API and the File API, which allow for more interactive web pages.</li>
          <li>Changes to <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/devnews/index.php/2009/11/16/component-directory-lockdown-new-in-firefox-3-6/" title="This link points to a Mozilla website in English" >how third-party software can integrate with Firefox</a> in order to prevent crashes.</li>

        </ul>


Get it now...

<a href="http://www.mozilla-europe.org/en/firefox/3.6/releasenotes/"><div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Screen-shot-2010-01-23-at-11.18.11.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-01-23 at 11.18.11.png" border="0" width="295" height="169" /></div></a>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Apple Launches iPad at Latest Creation Event</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/apple-launches-ipad-at-latest-creation-event/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jan 2010 20:13:54 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[In todays news...

Apple have released their fabled tablet computer, called (we now know) the iPad

The missing first page of the bible is discovered, stating "The Following Story is Fictional and Does Not Depict Any Actual Person or Event"

The Pope unifies all religions under a humanist banner

All wars are overJohn Lennon and George Harrison are discovered alive and well, having had a nice long relaxing holiday during which they've written ten albums worth of new material

The Beatles reform...

All carbon and other greenhouse gases are sucked from the atmosphere by aliens, who also remove all fossil fuels from the planet

We are forced to adopt entirely renewable energy sources, and the future environmental stability of the planet is secured...

Some of this is true, some is not...

The most important question of course is when can I order my iPad in the UK, and how can I justify it to my wife... (all comments and suggestions gratefully received...)

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/8C1E30D0-B213-41E5-97A3-03E94E9B0707.jpg" alt="8C1E30D0-B213-41E5-97A3-03E94E9B0707.jpg" border="0" width="508" height="494" /></div>
]]></content:encoded>

<title>Sunnyfields Poultry Housing</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/sunnyfields-poultry-housing/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 03 Feb 2010 14:05:08 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Portfolio]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="portfolio"><![CDATA[Portfolio]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Clients]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Web Development]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Web Help]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="web-help"><![CDATA[Web Help]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=624</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href = "http://www.sunnyfieldspoultryhousing.co.uk/" target = "_blank" rel = "nofollow">
<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/SunnyfieldsPoultryHousing1.jpg" alt="SunnyfieldsPoultryHousing.jpg" border="0" width="500" height="586" /></div>
</a>

Sunnyfields Poultry Housing is a small family run company based in the heart of the Blackdown Hills, near Honiton Devon.

They make beautifully handcrafted chicken and duck houses.

Their site is built around a customised Wordpress blog.


<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/SunnyFieldsPoultryBanner.png" alt="SunnyFieldsPoultryBanner.png" border="0" width="500" height="162" /></div>
]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Party Plan Together</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/party-plan-together/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 03 Feb 2010 14:14:51 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Portfolio]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="portfolio"><![CDATA[Portfolio]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=631</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href = "http://www.partyplantogether.co.uk/" target = "_blank" rel = "nofollow">
<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/PartyPlanTogether.jpg" alt="PartyPlanTogether.jpg" border="0" width="500" height="586" /></div>
</a>


Party Plan Together is a central place for everyone in the party plan business and anyone else who is thinking of starting a new career in direct sales or network marketing.

It is built around a customised wordpress blog.

It has a "magazine style front page, highlighting featured articles.

It has advertising space on the left and right of each page.

It also included a forum, for members to discuss any issues they wish (screenshot below).

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/PartyPlanTogetherForum.png" alt="PartyPlanTogetherForum.png" border="0" width="500" height="411" /></div>]]></content:encoded>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Screen-shot-2010-02-03-at-17.39.15.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-02-03 at 17.39.15.png" border="0" width="242" height="265" align="right" />Western Digital have released a USB 3.0 version of their popular My Book external hard drive.

The SuperSpeed USB 3.0 transfers data at 4.8 gigabit per second. Thatâ€™s up to 10 times faster than USB 2.0.

Of course you'll need a USB 3.0 compatible computer to make the most of all that speed.

However if you're looking for a new external drive, you can always get a USB 3.0 version as they are backwards compatible.  That way you'll be future-proofed for when you get a new USB 3.0 computer.

These external hard drives are great to use for backing up all your important files, photos and movies.

I own several USB external hard drives, all from Western Digital.

I've found them all to be extremely reliable and more than fit for purpose.

Check out the Amazon <a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/redirect.html?ie=UTF8&location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.co.uk%2FWestern-Digital-Internal-Network-Storage%2Fb%3Fie%3DUTF8%26node%3D163514031%26ref_%3Damb%255Flink%255F79964065%255F3&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=ur2&camp=1634&creative=19450">Western Digital Store</a><img src="https://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=ur2&o=2" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" /> for the full range and some of the best prices...]]></content:encoded>

<title>Tish Tash Toys</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/tish-tash-toys/</link>

<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href = "http://www.tishtashtoys.com/" title = "Tish Tash Toys" target = "_blank">
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Tish_Tash_Toys.jpg" alt="Tish_Tash_Toys.jpg" border="0" width="500" height="525" align="center" />
</a>

Tish Tash Toys is an online toy shop and party plan company

It has a separate blog:
<a href = "http://www.tishtashtoys.com/blog/" target = "_blank">

</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Pixelmator 1.5.1 Update is now available</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/pixelmator-1-5-1-update-is-now-available/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 12 Feb 2010 12:50:05 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Pixelmator]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="pixelmator"><![CDATA[Pixelmator]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=665</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.pixelmator.com/"><div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Screen-shot-2010-02-12-at-12.41.38.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-02-12 at 12.41.38.png" border="0" width="409" height="94" /></div></a>

My favourite image editor program has just had an update.

New in this release:
<ul>
<li>Brush Collections</li>
<li>Fit Images and Crop Images Automator Actions</li>
<li>Move to Applications dialog (thank you to the Potion Factory and Delicious Library for inspiring this feature)</li>
<li>A tiny Dock menu</li>
<li>The ability to change the background color of the work area</li>
<li>Many more tiny improvements and important bug fixes</li>
</ul>

Like it says on the tin, "Image editing for the rest of us"

I can't recommend this app enough.

It cost's around &pound;40, but you get a very large amount of bang for your sterling ! !

I believe that for a large amount of image editing work it can give the much more expensive Photoshop a run for its money.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Screen-shot-2010-02-12-at-12.48.34.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-02-12 at 12.48.34.png" border="0" width="500" height="225" /></div>


]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Griffin Release PowerBlock Reserve</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/griffin-release-powerblock-reserve/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 12 Feb 2010 14:10:18 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[battery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="battery"><![CDATA[battery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="power"><![CDATA[power]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=672</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Screen-shot-2010-02-12-at-14.01.30.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-02-12 at 14.01.30.png" border="0" width="275" height="296" align="right" />Griffin have released what looks like a handy iPhone power accessory,

If like me you're finding your iPhone battery running out a bit quickly, especially if your having a GTA China Town Wars marathon, you might find this little add on useful.

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/Screen-shot-2010-02-12-at-14.04.49.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-02-12 at 14.04.49.png" border="0" width="143" height="239" align="left" /> This AC charger for your device has a detachable backup battery that you can take with you to give you extra juice out on the road.

So while you're charging you iPhone etc, you're also charging your extra battery... neat ! !

<a href="http://www.griffintechnology.com/products/powerblock-reserve#">See all the details here</a>



]]></content:encoded>
