<item>
<title>Search Your Evernote Account Directly From Google Chrome</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/search-your-evernote-account-directly-from-google-chrome/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 17 Feb 2010 19:57:59 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="chrome"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Evernote]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="evernote"><![CDATA[Evernote]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Google Chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google-chrome"><![CDATA[Google Chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Search Engines]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="search-engines"><![CDATA[Search Engines]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=675</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.evernote.com/"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/4568CA27-8938-4E3C-95D5-686D9CB12776.jpg" alt="4568CA27-8938-4E3C-95D5-686D9CB12776.jpg" border="0" width="196" height="49" align="right" /></a>

<a href="http://www.evernote.com/">Evernote</a> have just released an awesome new feature whereby you can search all your notes direct from the Google <a href="http://www.google.co.uk/chrome">Chrome Address</a> bar.

For those of you that haven't heard of it, <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/08/why-does-evernote-rock/">Evernote</a> is a fantastic app that allows you to capture lots of information in notes that can be synchronised across multiple devices/computers.

You can access these notes direct from the software on your computer, or via the web or even via your mobile device.

It's really good and I've come to depend on it.

And now:

<blockquote>"<a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=chrome">Google Chromeâ€™</a>s address bar doubles as a search bar, which makes it really easy to search various sites without actually going to them first. Now, you can add Evernote as a search engine in Google Chrome and search your notes from anywhere. Hereâ€™s how to set it up:

Go to the Preferences (Mac) or Tools (Windows) menu
<br>Click on the Manage button in the Default Search section
<br>Click to add a new search engine
<br>Type the following:

Name: Evernote
<br>Keyword: Evernote.com
<br>URL: http://www.evernote.com/search?q=%s"</blockquote>

And here's a litte video to help you more:

<object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/zofKzwqApQ4&color1=0xb1b1b1&color2=0xcfcfcf&hl=en_US&feature=player_embedded&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/zofKzwqApQ4&color1=0xb1b1b1&color2=0xcfcfcf&hl=en_US&feature=player_embedded&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" width="425" height="344"></embed></object>

Very nice Evernote, you just keep getting better and better!

<a href="http://blog.evernote.com/2010/02/17/searching-through-evernote-with-google-chrome/">Via</a>
]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Here Ends The BAROQUE CYCLE</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/here-ends-the-baroque-cycle/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 17 Feb 2010 23:21:41 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Books]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="books"><![CDATA[Books]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Neal Stephenson]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="neal-stephenson"><![CDATA[Neal Stephenson]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Reading Neal]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="reading-neal"><![CDATA[Reading Neal]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=680</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<table border = "0">
<tr>
<td>
<div style="text-align:center;">
<a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/0099410680?ie=UTF8&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=as2&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=0099410680"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/23DD764C-B1F9-4874-A31B-6EDBE9BCFCD1.jpg" alt="23DD764C-B1F9-4874-A31B-6EDBE9BCFCD1.jpg" border="0" width="160"/></a></div></td>
<td><div style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/0099410699?ie=UTF8&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=as2&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=0099410699"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/DB2A8A69-AAA3-4606-8877-7260410CBC52.jpg" alt="DB2A8A69-AAA3-4606-8877-7260410CBC52.jpg" border="0" width="160" />
</a>
</div>
</td><td><div style="text-align:center;"><a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/0099463369?ie=UTF8&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=as2&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=0099463369"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/76C59546-75E1-491B-9919-33C8508C3B20.jpg" alt="76C59546-75E1-491B-9919-33C8508C3B20.jpg" border="0" width="160"  />
</a>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

So I've finally finished reading the momentous Baroque Cycle by <a href="http://www.nealstephenson.com/">Neal Stephenson</a> for the second time.

Truly three of my favourite ever books, but they do require an investment in time to read them all..!

<a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/redirect.html?ie=UTF8&location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.co.uk%2Fs%3Fie%3DUTF8%26search-alias%3Daps%26ref_%3Da9%5Fsc%5F1%26qid%3D1266448556%26field-keywords%3Dbaroque%2520cycle&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=ur2&camp=1634&creative=19450">The Baroque Cycle</a><img src="https://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=ur2&o=2" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" /> is a series of historical novels and is in some respects a prequel to <a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/0099410672?ie=UTF8&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=as2&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=0099410672">Cryptonomicon</a><img src="http://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=as2&o=2&a=0099410672" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" />
(another one of my other favourite-est books).

<blockquote>"The story follows the adventures of a sizeable cast of characters living amidst some of the central events of the late seventeenth and early eighteenth centuries in Europe. 

Despite featuring a literary treatment consistent with historical fiction, Stephenson has characterized the work as science fiction, due to the presence of some anomalous occurrences and the work's particular emphasis on themes relating to science and technology"  

<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Baroque_Cycle">Source</a></blockquote>

These books are truly immersive, intelligent, entertaining and humorous.

If you're into history and technology you will enjoy them greatly.








]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Ivy Bridge</title>

<item>
<title>How Many Times Do You Tweet a Day?</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/how-many-times-do-you-tweet-a-day/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 26 Feb 2010 15:07:57 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="blogging"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Microblogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="microblogging"><![CDATA[Microblogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[social]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="social"><![CDATA[social]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[tweet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tweet"><![CDATA[tweet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[tweeting]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tweeting"><![CDATA[tweeting]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[tweets]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tweets"><![CDATA[tweets]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="twitter"><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=716</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/10/facebook-accounts-for-a-seventh-of-uk-web-traffic/?preview=true&preview_id=451&preview_nonce=d97cacbfae">Facebook might be huge</a> but these figures released from Twitter are astonishing!

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/C0B75039-B092-4A06-94C3-79000098269F.jpg" alt="C0B75039-B092-4A06-94C3-79000098269F.jpg" border="0" width="580" /></div>

It's the growth that is phenomenal!  

<blockquote>Folks were tweeting 5,000 times a day in 2007. By 2008, that number was 300,000, and by 2009 it had grown to 2.5 million per day. Tweets grew 1,400% last year to 35 million per day. Today, we are seeing 50 million tweets per dayâ€”that's an average of 600 tweets per second.</blockquote>

600 tweets per second,  and 1400% growth, that a lot of tweeting!

Well done everyone!

By the way you can follow me <a href="https://twitter.com/danielhpavey">here.</a>

<a href="http://blog.twitter.com/2010/02/measuring-tweets.html">Source</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Dropbox for iPhone Updated</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=721</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 28 Feb 2010 09:55:16 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[cloud]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="cloud"><![CDATA[cloud]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Dropbox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dropbox"><![CDATA[Dropbox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[file storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="file-storage"><![CDATA[file storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="updates"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=721</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;">
<a href = "https://www.dropbox.com/referrals/NTQ2MjE2Njk">
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/IMG_3075.png" alt="IMG_3075.PNG" border="0" width="320" height="480" />
</a>
</div>

<a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/09/so-is-the-dropbox-iphone-app-out-yet/">Dropbox</a>. my favourite cloud file backup solution has just had it's iPhone client updated.

New features added include:
<ul>
<li>locking the app with a passcode</li>
<li>copying file and image sharing links to the clipboard</li>
<li>adjusting photo and video upload quality settings</li>
<li>full-screen document viewing</li>
<li>a scroll bar for navigating large documents</li>
<li>the ability to zoom in on photos</li>
<li>the search feature now allows users to search sub-folders</lo>
<li>the application will default to displaying the last-used folder on startup</li>
</ul?


Nice list of improvements...

<div style="text-align:center;">
<a href = "https://www.dropbox.com/referrals/NTQ2MjE2Njk">
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/IMG_3073.png" alt="IMG_3073.PNG" border="0" width="320" height="480" />
</a>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Dropbox for iPhone Updated</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=722</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 28 Feb 2010 09:56:03 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[cloud]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="cloud"><![CDATA[cloud]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Dropbox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dropbox"><![CDATA[Dropbox]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[file storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="file-storage"><![CDATA[file storage]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="updates"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=722</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;">
<a href = "https://www.dropbox.com/referrals/NTQ2MjE2Njk">
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/IMG_3075.png" alt="IMG_3075.PNG" border="0" width="320" height="480" />
</a>
</div>

<a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/2009/09/so-is-the-dropbox-iphone-app-out-yet/">Dropbox</a>. my favourite cloud file backup solution has just had it's iPhone client updated.

New features added include:
<ul>
<li>locking the app with a passcode</li>
<li>copying file and image sharing links to the clipboard</li>
<li>adjusting photo and video upload quality settings</li>
<li>full-screen document viewing</li>
<li>a scroll bar for navigating large documents</li>
<li>the ability to zoom in on photos</li>
<li>the search feature now allows users to search sub-folders</lo>
<li>the application will default to displaying the last-used folder on startup</li>
</ul?


Nice list of improvements...

<div style="text-align:center;">
<a href = "https://www.dropbox.com/referrals/NTQ2MjE2Njk">
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/IMG_3073.png" alt="IMG_3073.PNG" border="0" width="320" height="480" />
</a>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Turn Your iPhone into a TV Remote with a RedEye Mini</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/turn-your-iphone-into-a-tv-remote-with-a-redeye-mini/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 02 Mar 2010 21:00:20 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Accessories]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="accessories"><![CDATA[Accessories]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Cool Tools]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="cool-tools"><![CDATA[Cool Tools]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[RedEye Mini]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="redeye-mini"><![CDATA[RedEye Mini]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=729</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/9178D129-E1A1-435F-85AA-9C2C938EE86F.jpg" alt="9178D129-E1A1-435F-85AA-9C2C938EE86F.jpg" border="0" width="480" height="310" /></div>

I don't know about you, but in my house our TV remote has mystical powers.

It can be right there for hours and then suddently... gone !

And almost impossible to find again, it's gotta be some kind of magic... (or just my kids)

However I don't seem to have the same problem with my <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=iphone">iPhone</a>, it's never more that a few feet away from me, and if the kids go near it, they know that swift retribution will follow !

So this little device from RedEye looks just the thing to solve my remote control woes!

It simply plugs into the headphone socket on your device, leaving your dock connector open, and then beams out a limitless array of IR commands.

No news on availability in the UK, so if you see it let me know & I'll do the same for you!

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/C4499858-9B2D-4E17-B814-C72BFDF55D7E.jpg" alt="C4499858-9B2D-4E17-B814-C72BFDF55D7E.jpg" border="0" width="580"  /></div>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>729</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2010-03-02 22:00:20</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-03-02 21:00:20</wp:post_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
<wp:ping_status>closed</wp:ping_status>
<wp:post_name>turn-your-iphone-into-a-tv-remote-with-a-redeye-mini</wp:post_name>
<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

<title>The Best Google Chrome Feature</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/the-best-google-chrome-feature/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 03 Mar 2010 14:39:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Browsers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="browsers"><![CDATA[Browsers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Features]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="features"><![CDATA[Features]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google"><![CDATA[google]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Google Chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google-chrome"><![CDATA[Google Chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=731</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[I've been using Google's <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=chrome">Chrome</a> browser for a few weeks now and I'm slowly falling in love with it...

Before that I had always been a <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=firefox">Firefox</a> devotee.

But like a lot of users I found Firefox's <a href="http://www.pcmech.com/article/firefox-3-hogs-memory-like-crazy/">memory hogging </a>inclinations to a bit distracting at times!

In fact that was one of the main reasons I started using Chrome.

As time goes on I am finding more and more thing to like about it, especially now that extensions are available for the Mac Beta!

However a really nice feature of Chrome is the ability to resize text input boxes on the fly (see the video below).

This is a really simple yet really nice bit of usability, one of those nice little touches that go a long way!

Are you using Google Chrome ?

Which feature do you like the most ?

<object width="560" height="340"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/xt0VA5TWe1M&hl=en_US&fs=1&"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/xt0VA5TWe1M&hl=en_US&fs=1&" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="560" height="340"></embed></object>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>731</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2010-03-03 15:39:37</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-03-03 14:39:37</wp:post_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
<wp:ping_status>closed</wp:ping_status>

<item>
<title>View From Under a Bridge</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/view-from-under-a-bridge/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 07 Mar 2010 17:29:46 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhoneography]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphoneography"><![CDATA[iPhoneography]]></category>

<item>
<title>Paypal Launches New and Improved iPhone App</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/paypal-launches-new-and-improved-iphone-app/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 16 Mar 2010 12:30:50 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[app]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="app"><![CDATA[app]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[appstore]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="appstore"><![CDATA[appstore]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ecommerce]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ecommerce"><![CDATA[ecommerce]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="paypal"><![CDATA[Paypal]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="release"><![CDATA[release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=764</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/paypaliphonesplash.jpg" alt="paypaliphonesplash.jpg" border="0" width="580" height="290" /></div>

Paypal have today released a new version of its <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/category/iphone/">iPhone</a> app.

As well as having a snazzy new animated splash screen, it included one feature that was sorely missing from its previous version.

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/Screen-shot-2010-03-16-at-12.24.09.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-03-16 at 12.24.09.png" border="0" width="190" height="185" align="right" />It now allows you to send a money request to your contacts (yippee!)

PayPal has offered a free application for the iPhone ever since the App Store launched in mid-2008, and it has gradually been improving over time.

The other significant new features are the ability to withdraw money from Paypal and deposit in into your bank account.

It also has some nifty integration with <a href="http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/bump/id305479724?mt=8&ign-mpt=uo%3D2">Bump</a> which enables you to exchange money with other iPhone users simply by tapping the two phones together ! !

This surely is the stuff that dreams are made of...!

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/Mobile-Photo-16-Mar-2010-12-10-40.jpg" alt="Mobile Photo 16 Mar 2010 12 10 40.jpg" border="0" width="320" height="480" align="right" />
Does this spell the end for cash ?

I hope so, that would be nice wouldn't it !

Although it would require everyone that you knew to have an iPhone... but your mates could never dibb out on paying for a round !

]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Western Digital Scorpio 750GB</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/western-digital-scorpio-750gb/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 16 Mar 2010 16:19:05 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hard-drives"><![CDATA[Hard Drives]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Macbook]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="macbook"><![CDATA[Macbook]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Upgrades]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="upgrades"><![CDATA[Upgrades]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="western-digital"><![CDATA[Western Digital]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=769</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The big question on my mind at the moment is....

Should I but a Western Digital Scorpio 750GB as an upgrade for my <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=macbook">Macbook</a>? ? ?


<a href="http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B002L1V51O?ie=UTF8&tag=alsda-21&linkCode=as2&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=B002L1V51O">
<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/C7C9218B-5A60-41E9-9221-C91C5927D9CF.jpg" alt="C7C9218B-5A60-41E9-9221-C91C5927D9CF.jpg" border="0" width="280" height="280" /></div>
</a><img src="http://www.assoc-amazon.co.uk/e/ir?t=alsda-21&l=as2&o=2&a=B002L1V51O" width="1" height="1" border="0" alt="" style="border:none !important; margin:0px !important;" />

This massive drive would certainly end my storage woes, and according to the tech specs and reviews, it has great performance whilst remaining quiet.

I don't know about you, but I am finding my computer filling up with more and more space hogging multimedia files.

Family photo's and home videos...

An ever growing music collection...

An increasing number of feature films (we no longer have a DVD player, and it's so easy to connect up the Macbook to the TV that we just watch films using the computer)...

<iframe src="http://rcm-uk.amazon.co.uk/e/cm?lt1=_blank&bc1=000000&IS2=1&bg1=FFFFFF&fc1=000000&lc1=0000FF&t=alsda-21&o=2&p=8&l=as1&m=amazon&f=ifr&md=0M5A6TN3AXP2JHJBWT02&asins=B002L1V51O" style="width:120px;height:240px;" scrolling="no" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" frameborder="0" align = "right"></iframe>But...

It's soooooo big, it makes me nervous for some reason.

Plus of course installing a new hard drive can always be a bit nerve racking...  Will it work, will I retain all my data and above mentioned multimedia...?

I'm confident that I can do the install fine, and with <a href="http://www.apple.com/macosx/what-is-macosx/time-machine.html">Time Machine</a> nothing should go wrong!

Hmmm, what do you think ?

Should I get one of these ?]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>What to Blog About ?</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/what-to-blog-about/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 16 Mar 2010 20:43:35 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="top-tips"><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[advice]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="advice"><![CDATA[advice]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[blog]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="blog"><![CDATA[blog]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="blogging"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[resources]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="resources"><![CDATA[resources]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="top-tips"><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=775</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[A blog can be one of the most cost effective ways to market your web site.

But sometimes it can be very hard to put finger to keyboard and come up with something. (bloggers block ?)

So here is a list of over 100 ideas to get you started.

Just browse down and if one grabs you, seize the moment and get blogging!

<a href="http://www.blackdownblogs.co.uk/how-many-words-should-a-blog-post-have/">And remember just 200 words can be enough !</a>

<h2><strong>About your Business</strong></h2> 
<ol> 
<li> Why youâ€™re different (and better) than your competition</li> 
<li> A video tutorial showing how to use your most popular product</li> 
<li>The problems your sales people hear about most</li> 
<li>The answer to the most common email you get</li> 
<li>Share the tools do you use to do your job</li> 
<li>The secret ways to use your site/product</li> 
<li>The top 10 Wordpress plugins you use on your site</li> 
<li>How you use your favorite social media site</li> 
<li>How you built your email list</li> 
<li>How youâ€™re using Facebook</li> 
<li>Look at your site logs &amp; answer customer questions</li> 
<li>How you delegate tasks (or what you mucked up by not delegating)</li> 
<li>Use Wordtrackerâ€™s <a href="http://labs.wordtracker.com/keyword-questions/">Keyword Question Tool</a> and answer popular questions</li> 
<li>Write about why youâ€™re not using social media at all</li> 
<li>Answer questions left in your comment section</li> 
<li>Write about the personal branding tactics you use</li> 
<li>Give 5 reasons to sign up to your email newsletter</li> 
<li>How you learned to do what you do</li> 
<li>Create a list of your favorite X</li> 
<li>What youâ€™re doing to beat the summer slump or winter blues</li> 
<li>Share a case study</li> 
<li>Provide an end of the week link roundup</li> 
<li>Review something</li> 
<li>Reveal the best niche blogs to guestblog for</li> 
<li>What keeps you up at night</li> 
<li>Share a time when you got it wrong in 2010</li> 
<li>Your strategies for coming up with blog topics.</li> 
<li>Branding tips that have worked for your business</li> 
<li>50 reasons why someone should hire you</li> 
<li>5 things people should be focusing on but arenâ€™t</li> 
<li>What can other industries learn from yours</li> 
</ol> 
<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/F195C557-4325-4648-B1E1-BAB87184E8A1.jpg" alt="F195C557-4325-4648-B1E1-BAB87184E8A1.jpg" border="0" width="550" height="330" /></div>
<h2><strong>Highlight Your Customers</strong></h2> 
<ol> 
<li>Put the spotlight on your most active commenters</li> 
<li>Praise your best customers</li> 
<li>Post a question and let the community to answer it</li> 
<li>How customers can woo your customer service department for free stuff</li> 
<li>Give something away to one of your blog readers.</li> 
<li>Feature a video detailing a customerâ€™s success with your product</li> 
<li>Share your biggest screw up with a customerâ€¦and how you made it right</li> 
<li>Publish a customer testimonial</li> 
<li>Explain the benefits of being a customer</li> 
<li>Share local organizations you support and ask customers to share their favorites</li> 
<li>How customers can connect with you on social media</li> 
<li>Hold an event for Twitter followers to meet and blog it</li> 
</ol> 
<h2><strong>Get Personal</strong></h2> 
<ol> 
<li>What have you read lately that inspired/angered you?</li> 
<li>Introduce your staff</li> 
<li>Share the best decision you made as a SMB</li> 
<li>Your biggest challenge as a SMB owner</li> 
<li>What you love best about being a SMB owner. What you don&#8217;t like.</li> 
<li>The danger of doing everything by yourself</li> 
<li>Write about the achievement you&#8217;re most proud of</li> 
<li>A time when you got it right in 2009</li> 
<li>Create a video introducing your team to your community</li> 
<li>Get your rant on</li> 
<li>How to remain productive working at home</li> 
<li>Introduce a new employee and what they bring to the table</li> 
<li>Share the local vendors you trust</li> 
<li>Give people a video tour of your building</li> 
<li>Describe your company culture</li> 
<li>Your new baby (whether thatâ€™s a real baby, a pet, a new project for 2010, the car youâ€™ve been restoring for the past two years, etc)</li> 
<li>Share your companyâ€™s history or story</li> 
<li>Tell a story not about your company</li> 
<li>Share 10 things youâ€™re thankful for</li> 
<li>Whatâ€™s next for your company</li> 
<li>A list of your most trafficked posts</li> 
</ol> 
<h2><strong>Focus on your Industry</strong></h2> 
<ol> 
<li>Write 10 ways your industry will change this year</li> 
<li> Break down the new laws that will affect your niche in 2010</li> 
<li>Create a list of the best industry resources</li> 
<li>Talk about why things are better today (or not) than they were 10 years ago</li>
<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/2829632A-B7E1-4297-8643-3244071B89E5.jpg" alt="2829632A-B7E1-4297-8643-3244071B89E5.jpg" border="0" width="250" align="right" />
<li>Attend industry events and blog about them</li> 
<li>Your best marketing tips</li> 
<li>How your industry is like Your Favorite TV Show [I suggest using Glee. Because that's my favorite show.]</li> 
<li>The ugly truth about your industry</li> 
<li>The 8 people in your industry you want to meet</li> 
<li>What someone needs to consider before getting involved in your industry</li> 
<li>Comment on an industry-related conversation going on in LinkedIn or Google Groups</li> 
<li>Talk about the â€œthingâ€ that would rock your industry if invented or put together</li> 
<li>Create a chart that breaks down a complicated industry issue or problem</li> 
<li>Interview someone well-known in your world and profile them</li> 
<li>Rewrite an old post with fresh eyes and new ideas</li> 
<li>Publish a presentation you gave somewhere else (with permission)</li> 
<li>Have a chat with a competitor and blog about it (again, with permission)</li> 
<li>Search Google News for relevant press releases and news about your industry. Write your own take.</li> 
<li>Debunk a long-standing myth</li> 
<li>Host a seminar or meetup and blog about</li> 
<li>Create a list of the 10 books that someone in your industry should read.</li> 
<li>Post about what youâ€™d like to see fixed in your industry</li> 
<li>Conferences people in your industry should attend/speak at</li> 
<li>Your favorite untapped traffic sources in your industry</li> 
<li>Issues in your space that deserve more attention</li> 
</ol> 
<h2><strong>Go Social</strong></h2> 
<ol> 
<li>How youâ€™re using Twitter to increase earnings</li> 
<li>Post a video that has nothing to do with your industry but that you think people would enjoy.</li> 
<li>Post a picture. [Browse <a href="http://www.stumbleupon.com/">StumleUpon</a> for inspiration]</li> 
<li>Participate in a blog meme like last monthâ€™s <a href="http://www.gwenbell.com/blog/2009/11/30/the-best-of-2009-blog-challenge.html">Best of 09</a></li> 
<li>Share the best social media campaigns you&#8217;ve seen, big and small</li> 
<li>Hold a contest and pit people against each other</li> 
<li> Create a poll. Blog the result.</li> 
<li>Invite a guest blogger to post on your blog</li> 
<li>How social media increased your ROI this year</li> 
<li>How social media did nothing but confuse you this year</li> 
<li>Search Delicious for popular posts on your topics and take a new stance</li> 
<li>Go to your industryâ€™s Wikipedia page and see what people are talking about in the Discussions area. Comment on it on your blog.</li> 
<li>Post photos from your company party/team building workshop</li> 
<li> Find a question on <a href="http://answers.yahoo.com/">Yahoo Answers</a> or <a href="http://answers.onstartups.com/">OnStartups</a> and respond on your blog</li> 
<li>Create a list of the Must Follow Twitter people in your industry</li> 
</ol> 

<p> &nbsp;</p><p> &nbsp;</p>
<p>This list came from <a href="http://smallbiztrends.com/2010/01/100-smb-blogging-ideas.html">here</a>, thanks !
</p>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Letter to the Financial Times on the Digital Economy Bill</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/letter-to-the-financial-times-on-the-digital-economy-bill/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 18 Mar 2010 16:00:43 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Digital Economy Bill]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="digital-economy-bill"><![CDATA[Digital Economy Bill]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=789</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[ <p><em>A letter to the Financial Times, signed by Tom Watson, MP, Stephen Fry and technology industry leaders:</em></p> 
<p>Sir, We regret that the House of Lords adopted amendment 120A to the digital economy bill (â€œBill will censor internet, providers claimâ€, March 6). This amendment not only significantly changes the injunctions procedure in the UK but will lead to an increase in internet service providers blocking websites accused of illegally hosting copyrighted material without cases even reaching a judge. The amendment seeks to address the legitimate concerns of rights-holders but would have unintended consequences that far outweigh any benefits it could bring.</p> 
<p>Endorsing a policy that would encourage the blocking of websites by UK broadband providers or other internet companies is a very serious step for the UK to take. There are myriad legal, technical and practical issues to reconcile before this can be considered a proportionate and necessary public policy option. In some cases, these may never be reconciled. These issues have not even been considered in this case.</p> 
<p>The Lords have been thoughtful in their consideration of the bill to date. It is therefore bitterly disappointing that the House has allowed an amendment with obvious shortcomings to proceed without challenging its proponents to consider and address the full consequences. Put simply, blocking access as envisaged by this clause would both widely disrupt the internet in the UK and elsewhere and threaten freedom of speech and the open internet, without reducing copyright infringement as intended. To rush through such a controversial proposal at the tail end of a parliament, without any kind of consultation with consumers or industry, is very poor lawmaking.</p> 
<p>We are particularly concerned that a measure of this kind as a general purpose policy could have an adverse impact on the reputation of the UK as a place to do online business and conflict with the broader objectives of Digital Britain. This debate has created tension between specific interest groups and the bigger prize of promoting a policy framework that supports our digital economy and appropriately balances rights and responsibilities. All parties should take steps to safeguard this prize and place it at the heart of public policy in this area.<br /> 
<strong><br /> 
Tom Alexander,<br /> 
Chief Executive, Orange</strong></p> 
<p>Richard Allan,<br /> 
Director of Policy EU, Facebook</p> 
<p>Neil Berkett,<br /> 
Chief Executive, Virgin Media</p> 
<p>Matt Brittin,<br /> 
Managing Director, Google UK and Ireland</p> 
<p>Charles Dunstone,<br /> 
Chairman, Talk Talk Group</p> 
<p>Stephen Fry</p> 
<p>Jessica Hendrie-LiaÃ±o,<br /> 
Chair, Internet Services Providers Association</p> 
<p>Jill Johnstone,<br /> 
International Director, Consumer Focus</p> 
<p>Jim Killock,<br /> 
Executive Director, Open Rights Group</p> 
<p>Mark Lewis,<br /> 
Managing Director, eBay UK</p> 
<p>Ian Livingston,<br /> 
Chief Executive, BT Group</p> 
<p>Sarah Oates,<br /> 
University of Glasgow</p> 
<p>Jenny Pickerill,<br /> 
University of Leicester</p> 
<p>Mark Rabe,<br /> 
Managing Director, Yahoo! UK and Ireland</p> 
<p>Paul Reilly,<br /> 
University of Leicester</p> 
<p>Jess Search,<br /> 
Founder, Shooting People independent film makers</p> 
<p>Ian Walden,<br /> 
Queen Mary, University of London</p> 
<p>Tom Watson, MP</p> 


<a href="http://www.dontdisconnect.us/letter-to-the-financial-times-on-the-digital-economy-bill/">Source</a>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>A Great Customer Support Story!</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/a-great-customer-support-story/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 24 Mar 2010 11:53:16 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="funny"><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[comedy]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="comedy"><![CDATA[comedy]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[customer support]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="customer-support"><![CDATA[customer support]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="funny"><![CDATA[Funny]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[helpdesk]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="helpdesk"><![CDATA[helpdesk]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[humour]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="humour"><![CDATA[humour]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[it support]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="it-support"><![CDATA[it support]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=810</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>I've heard this helpdesk / customer support story before.  I couldn't say if it's an entirely true story, however I have had similar conversation when providing both telephone and face to face support !

Read on, it's got a good punchline !

<p><h2>Actual dialog of a former Wordperfect Customer Support employee:</h2><br /> 

â€œWordperfect Customer Support; may I help you?â€<br /> 

â€œYes, well, Iâ€™m having trouble with WordPerfect.â€<br /> 

â€œWhat sort of trouble?â€<br /> 

â€œWell, I was just typing along, and all of a sudden the words went away.â€<br /> 

â€œWent away?â€<br /> 

â€œThey disappeared.â€<br /> 

â€œHmm. So what does your screen look like now?â€<br /> 

â€œNothing.â€<br /> 

â€œNothing?â€<br /> 

â€œItâ€™s blank; it wonâ€™t accept anything when I type.â€<br /> 

â€œAre you still in WordPerfect, or did you get out?â€<br /> 

â€œHow do I tell?â€<br /> 

â€œCan you see the C: prompt on the screen?â€<br /> 

â€œWhatâ€™s a sea-prompt?â€<br /> 

â€œNever mind. Can you move the cursor around on the screen?â€<br /> 

â€œThere isnâ€™t any cursor: I told you, it wonâ€™t accept anything I type.â€<br /> 

â€œDoes your monitor have a power indicator?â€<br /> 

â€œWhatâ€™s a monitor?â€<br /> 

â€œItâ€™s the thing with the screen on it that looks like a TV.<br /> 

â€œDoes it have a little light that tells you when itâ€™s on?â€<br /> 

â€œI donâ€™t know.â€<br /> 

â€œWell, then look on the back of the monitor and find where the power 
cord goes into it. Can you see that?â€<br /> 

â€œYes, I think so.â€<br /> 

â€œGreat! Follow the cord to the plug, and tell me if itâ€™s plugged into the wall.â€<br /> 

â€œYes, it is.â€<br /> 

â€œWhen you were behind the monitor, did you notice that there were two cables plugged into the back of it, not just one?â€<br /> 

â€œNo.â€<br /> 

â€œWell, there are. I need you to look back there again and find the other cable.â€<br /> 

â€œOkay, here it is.â€<br /> 

â€œFollow it for me, and tell me if itâ€™s plugged securely into the back of 
your computer.â€<br /> 

â€œI canâ€™t reach.â€<br /> 

â€œUh huh. Well, can you see if it is?â€<br /> 

â€œNo.â€<br /> 

â€œEven if you maybe put your knee on something and lean way over?â€<br /> 

â€œOh, itâ€™s not because I donâ€™t have the right angle-itâ€™s because itâ€™s dark.â€<br /> 

â€œDark?â€<br /> 

â€œYes-the office light is off, and the only light I have is coming in 
from the window.â€<br /> 

â€œWell, turn on the office light then.â€<br /> 

â€œI canâ€™t.â€<br /> 

â€œNo? Why not?â€<br /> 

â€œBecause thereâ€™s a power outage.â€<br /> 

â€œA powerâ€¦ A power outage? Aha! Okay, weâ€™ve got it licked now. Do you still have the boxes and manuals and packing stuff your computer came 
in?â€<br /> 

â€œWell, yes, I keep them in the closet.â€<br /> 

â€œGood! Go get them, and unplug your system and pack it up just like it was when you got it. Then take it back to the store you bought it 
from.â€<br /> 

â€œReally? Is it that bad?â€<br /> 

â€œYes, Iâ€™m afraid it is.â€<br /> 

â€œWell, all right then, I suppose. What do I tell them?â€<br /> 

â€œTell them youâ€™re too stupid to own a computer.â€</p> 

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/31F0DBEB-D799-4876-8F46-71C3A06477C4.jpg" alt="31F0DBEB-D799-4876-8F46-71C3A06477C4.jpg" border="0" width="350" height="315" /></div>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>Apple OS X 10.6.3 Snow Leopard Software Update Released</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/apple-os-x-10-6-3-snow-leopard-software-update-released/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 29 Mar 2010 16:58:53 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Snow Leopard]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="snow-leopard"><![CDATA[Snow Leopard]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software-release"><![CDATA[Software Release]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="updates"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=818</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/32DEF9D4-3F27-4D0E-9EB1-CCCCF02FBA75.jpg" alt="32DEF9D4-3F27-4D0E-9EB1-CCCCF02FBA75.jpg" border="0" width="384" height="500" align="right" /> 


The new Snow Leopard is out of the bag...

Here's what Apple have to say about it:

The 10.6.3 Update is recommended for all users running Mac OS X Snow Leopard and includes general operating system fixes that enhance the stability, compatibility, and security of your Mac, including fixes that:
<ul>
<li>improve the reliability and compatibility of QuickTime X
address compatibility issues with OpenGL-based applications
address an issue that causes background message colors to display incorrectly in Mail</li>
<li>resolve an issue that prevented files with the # or & characters in their names from opening in Rosetta applications</li>
<li>resolve an issue that prevented files from copying to Windows file servers</li>
<li>improve performance of Logic Pro 9 and Main Stage 2 when running in 64-bit mode</li>
<li>improve sleep and wake reliability when using Bonjour wake on demand
address a color issue in iMovie with HD content</li>
<li>improve printing reliability</li>
<li>resolve issues with recurring events in iCal when connected to an Exchange server</li>
<li>improve the reliability of 3rd party USB input devices</li>
<li>fix glowing, stuck, or dark pixels when viewing video from the iMac (Late 2009) built-in iSight camera</li>
</ul>



Not a very exciting list, but I'm sure a lot of hard work went in to it all the same !

Might me a new iTunes out soon though, that might be a little more lively !


<a href="http://naturescrusaders.wordpress.com/2009/10/12/endangered-snow-leopard-helped-by-ative-herders/uncia_uncia/">Image Source</a>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Victorinox Secure Pro USB Drive - Can get boy scouts out of horses hoofs</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/victorinox-secure-pro-usb-drive-can-get-boy-scouts-out-of-horses-hoofs/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 30 Mar 2010 11:27:10 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hardware"><![CDATA[Hardware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Backup]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=823</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/0E706FC5-E8D9-4532-BEAA-CEF2636E30B7.jpg" alt="0E706FC5-E8D9-4532-BEAA-CEF2636E30B7.jpg" border="0" width="600" height="385" /></div>

This has got to be one of those must buy items!

This Swiss Army Knife comes with an "un-hackable" USB drive.

The drive has a combination of AES256 technology and fingerprint security.

And this is the best bit, it will also self destruct if the drive is forced open ! ! !

Now available in the UK n capacities from 8GB to 32GB for between Â£50 and Â£180.

]]></content:encoded>

<title>BT Fire at Paddington Causes Major UK Outages</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/bt-fire-at-paddington-causes-major-uk-outages/</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 31 Mar 2010 13:59:08 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[A fire at Burne House in North Paddington, London was reported by BT today.

Apparently 437 local exchanges and up to 37,500 Datastream circuits have been affected.

BT said in a statement: 

<blockquote>â€œFollowing a fire at a BT exchange in the Paddington area, customers in parts of North and West London may be experiencing a loss of broadband and/or telephone service. Customers in other parts of the country may also be affected."
</blockquote>

How's that for network design...!]]></content:encoded>

<title>Lonely Primrose No. 2</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/lonely-primrose-no-2/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 09 Apr 2010 18:13:13 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhoneography]]></category>

<description></description>

<item>
<title>Opera Mini Browser App for iPhone Approved ! !</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/opera-mini-browser-app-for-iphone-approved/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 21:06:49 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[app]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="app"><![CDATA[app]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apps]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apps"><![CDATA[Apps]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[appstore]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="appstore"><![CDATA[appstore]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[browser]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="browser"><![CDATA[browser]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[opera]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="opera"><![CDATA[opera]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=874</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/6E069D83-9EAF-4B7D-BB0E-12A5105A3082.jpg" alt="6E069D83-9EAF-4B7D-BB0E-12A5105A3082.jpg" border="0" width="300" height="479" align="right" />
Wow !  Who'd have funk it !

Apple have actually approved the Opera browser for the iPhone!

<blockquote>"We are delighted to offer iPhone and iPod touch users a great browsing experience with the Opera Mini App," 
</blockquote>

said Lars Boilesen, CEO, Opera Software

The current vibe on the net is that is is a very fast browser.

Opera <blockquote>"enables fast mobile Web browsing by compressing data by up to 90 percent before sending content to the device, resulting in significantly improved page loading. Users of the app will notice an uptake in speed, especially on slower networks such as the 2G Edge network."</blockquote>

I've always had a soft spot for Opera and it will be interesting to see how successful it is in the iPhone.

Have you tried it ?

What do you think ?
]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>FlashBlock for Google Chrome</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/flashblock-for-google-chrome/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 15 Apr 2010 13:15:16 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="top-tips"><![CDATA[Top Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="chrome"><![CDATA[chrome]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Extenstions]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="extenstions"><![CDATA[Extenstions]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[FlashBlock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="flashblock"><![CDATA[FlashBlock]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPad]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ipad"><![CDATA[iPad]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=879</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[You may or may not agree with Apple's stance on not allowing Adobe Flash on the iPhone or iPad.

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/6252FD6F-A0CB-419C-BABE-A25E756E9288.jpg" alt="6252FD6F-A0CB-419C-BABE-A25E756E9288.jpg" border="0" width="195" height="185" align="left" /> However I don't know about you. but whenever my web browser is acting up, or crashing, or hogging CPU cycles, or memory, nine times out of ten, when I check the activity monitor Flash is the culprit !

If only there was a way you could disable or block flash...

Wait a minute there is!

If you're running Google <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/?s=chrome">Chrome</a> you can install the <a href="https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/gofhjkjmkpinhpoiabjplobcaignabnl?hl=en">FlashBlock</a> extension.

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/EABBFDC5-17BA-4700-AE49-C4E8F61873A3.jpg" alt="EABBFDC5-17BA-4700-AE49-C4E8F61873A3.jpg" border="0" width="410" height="340" /></div>

<blockquote>The extension automatically blocks flash content on webpages.
Each flash element is being replaced with a placeholder that allows you to load only selected elements on a given page.
You can also manage a whitelist of allowed websites via a configuration panel.

In general, FlashBlock helps with lowering memory usage, reducing cpu cycles,
and can be used as an alternative to AdBlock.</blockquote>

I've just installed it & will let you know how I get on !

You can get it yourself <a href="https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/gofhjkjmkpinhpoiabjplobcaignabnl?hl=en">here</a>

How do you get on with Flash?


]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<wp:comment_date_gmt>2010-05-27 04:15:05</wp:comment_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[I use FlashControl. It lets you to load and unload Flash objects and toggle their visibility. You can filter whole websites and even individual flash objects. It also has a better accuracy rating than FlashBlock.
You can get it at https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/mfidmkgnfgnkihnjeklbekckimkipmoe]]></wp:comment_content>

<item>
<title>What&#039;s New in iPhone OS 4.0</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/whats-new-in-iphone-os-4-0/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 15 Apr 2010 19:37:44 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="news"><![CDATA[News]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="apple"><![CDATA[Apple]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="iphone"><![CDATA[iPhone]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os"><![CDATA[OS]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS 4.0]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-4-0"><![CDATA[OS 4.0]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=884</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[In case you missed the news on those interwebs there is a new version of the software that runs your iPhone coming out later this year...

The iPhone OS (operating system) version 4.0 should be out this summer, and it boast a host of exciting new features that should enhance your iPhone experience !

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/AFB57282-5757-4870-877B-34C86F0CAAE8.jpg" alt="AFB57282-5757-4870-877B-34C86F0CAAE8.jpg" border="0" width="510" height="466" /></div>

Apple boasts of 100+ new features for users, but I won't spoil the surprise and tell you them all.

But some of them are too good not to share, so here is my list of the best new features in iPhone OS 4.0

<strong>Multitasking</strong>

This has been a continuous gripe since the iPhone came along.  Multitasking, where more than one app/program is running at the same time has not been possible on the iPhone so far.  However now:

<blockquote>"Developers will have access to seven multitasking services, which will allow tasks to be performed in the background while preserving performance and battery life. So youâ€™ll be able to make a Voice over IP call while playing a game or checking email, find a restaurant on Urbanspoon while listening to Pandora, and more"</blockquote>


<strong>Folders</strong>

This one is a doozy!  

At the moment the most Apps you can install on your iPhone is 180.  

However in iPhone OS 4.0 you will be able to organise your apps into folders and have easy (apparently) control over 2160 Apps!!!  Now that is app-tastic...


<strong>Mail</strong>

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/DDE45794-D945-4C33-92FB-F42EB35DE9F7.jpg" alt="DDE45794-D945-4C33-92FB-F42EB35DE9F7.jpg" border="0" width="512" height="512" /></div>

Not that exciting this one, but still pretty good if you're a heavy e-mail user:

<blockquote>"See messages from all your email accounts displayed together in a unified inbox, switch between inboxes more quickly, organize messages by threads"</blockquote>


But for me, I've saved the best till last...

<strong>iBooks</strong>

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/97037DF0-62F9-41B0-87F3-91DA7A92CCBB.jpg" alt="97037DF0-62F9-41B0-87F3-91DA7A92CCBB.jpg" border="0" width="359" height="493" /></div>

That sexy ebook reader you've seen on the <a href="http://www.alecksdad.com/apple-launches-ipad-at-latest-creation-event/">iPad</a> is now coming to the iPhone, complete with its free copy of Winnie the Pooh (one of my personal favourite books ever!)

If Apple are half as successful at changing the book publishing industry as they were at changing the music industry, the whole iBook thing should be very exciting...

Are you looking forward to iPhone OS 4.0 ?

I know I am...

]]></content:encoded>

<title>Find People to Follow on Twitter </title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/find-people-to-follow-on-twitter/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 16 Apr 2010 12:29:18 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="twitter"><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[follow]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="follow"><![CDATA[follow]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[tweet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="tweet"><![CDATA[tweet]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="twitter"><![CDATA[Twitter]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=887</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Need help finding people to follow?

Follow Finder analyses public social graph information (following and follower lists) on Twitter to find people you might want to follow

<a href="http://www.followfinder.googlelabs.com/"><div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/Screen-shot-2010-04-16-at-13.25.51.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-04-16 at 13.25.51.png" border="0" width="459" height="299" /></div></a>

Follow Finder generates two lists based on the public social connections on Twitter (follower and following lists):

<ul>
<li>Tweeps you might like: We start with the list of people you follow, find others with similar lists, and then identify accounts you might also want to follow. If people with similar lists tend to follow accounts that aren't in your list, we'll recommend those additional accounts to you. For example, if you follow CNN and the New York Times on Twitter, and most people who follow CNN and the New York Times also tend to follow TIME, we'll suggest TIME as a user to follow.</li>
<li>
Tweeps with similar followers: We find people with similar public lists of followers to yours. For example, if ten people are following you, and the same ten people are following a second user, we'll include the second user in this list. You may already be following some of these people.
</li>
</ul>

Give it a try <a href="http://www.followfinder.googlelabs.com/">here...</a>]]></content:encoded>

<title>WriteRoom Testing Testing One Two Three for Blogging</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/writeroom-testing-testing-one-two-three-for-blogging/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 16 Apr 2010 15:14:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="blogging"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Bloggers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="bloggers"><![CDATA[Bloggers]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="blogging"><![CDATA[blogging]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[review]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="review"><![CDATA[review]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[WriteRoom]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="writeroom"><![CDATA[WriteRoom]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[writing]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="writing"><![CDATA[writing]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=893</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ok, so I'll admit I'm not the greatest blogger / writer, but I am trying!

I have lately been finding that focusing on writing is proving more and more difficult.

I have two kids, a wife, 2 cats and a rubbish dog, so those alone take up enough of my time.

And now of course <a href = "twitter.com/danielhpavey">Twitter</a> has now become a big part of my life.  I enjoy <a href = "http://www.facebook.com/danielhpavey">Facebook</a> too and there are always e-mails pinging into my mailbox...

So how can I stay focused on the thing that I am writing at any one time?

<img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/Screen-shot-2010-04-16-at-16.08.02.png" alt="WriteRoom Testing Testing One Two Three for Blogging" border="0" width="178" height="188" align="right" />Well I am writing this using <a href="http://www.hogbaysoftware.com/products/writeroom">WriteRoom</a>.

I have seen it mentioned a few times by other blogging people as a good way to keep focussed, but I usually dismissed it.

"I can focus when I need to" I told myself, however today I have been having trouble concentrating on a piece I am trying to put together.

WriteRoom is a full screen writing environment.  

So one quick download later and here I am writing this in Writeroom:

<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/Screen-shot-2010-04-16-at-15.59.03.png" alt="WriteRoom Testing Testing One Two Three for Blogging" border="0" width="580" height="363" /></div>

You get a black screen, green text and nothing else...

Put the pointer to the bottom of the screen and you get a word count, nice addition!

Put the pointer to the top and your usual menu appears.

And I must say I like it!

I've written this quite quickly...

I've not looked at <a href = "twitter.com/danielhpavey">Twitter</a>...

I've not checked <a href = "http://www.facebook.com/danielhpavey">Facebook</a>...

And I don't know how many e-mail I have left un-read..!

Hmmm... I might stick with this for the 30 day free trial...

]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>How To Decide If Managed Hosting Is Right For Your Business</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/how-to-decide-if-managed-hosting-is-right-for-your-business/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 19 Apr 2010 15:35:43 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="internet"><![CDATA[Internet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="tips"><![CDATA[Tips]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[disaster recovery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="disaster-recovery"><![CDATA[disaster recovery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[managed services]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="managed-services"><![CDATA[managed services]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Sharepoint]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sharepoint"><![CDATA[Sharepoint]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Vmware]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="vmware"><![CDATA[Vmware]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=895</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Every competent business owner these days knows that it's essential to have some kind of presence on the Internet. The question that faces every company when deciding on a web site is how to operate the site without having to invest thousands in computer equipment and technical staff. That's when managed hosting can be of great benefit to small- and medium-sized businesses.

Many business owners and managers might be surprised to find that the first question to ask isn't about finding a web hosting service, but about the web site itself. In other words, what exactly does the company want its web site to do? A business web site could act like a billboard, simply giving information about what the business does and where to find it. Or it could be a full-blown online business, not only offering goods and services but using social networking tools to develop a customer community around its specialty. Deciding what the web site should do and be is the critical first step.

Web developers help businesses decide about the functions of their web sites, and then create the web sites according to those specifications. After the website is designed, however, it still must be regularly monitored for performance, updated with new information and upgraded when necessary. This takes a lot of an employee's time that some businesses would prefer to be spent elsewhere. At that point, managed hosting becomes an attractive alternative.

Just as with deciding a web site's purpose, there's a fundamental rule to selecting web hosting: "Cheap" isn't necessary "best." This is particularly true of managed hosting, which often calls for a higher level of technical skill and equipment than many low-level services can provide. The way to determine how well a web hosting service can fill a business' needs is to evaluate the service by four key qualifications: technical support, reliability, data transfer rate and data storage. These last three qualities are more commonly known as uptime, bandwidth and disk space.

Often hosting vendors will promote their services, especially disk space and bandwidth, as "unlimited." Business people in particularly know that no resource is ever "unlimited, " so it pays to know how to ask about specifics for each qualification. The web site's design can help by providing a business with standards for site, especially in terms of disk space and bandwidth. In addition, businesses should ask about the hosting service's reliability, or "uptime, " which often is expressed as a percentage such as 99.9 percent.

With managed hosting, technical support may not be as crucial an issue, since technical support usually serves businesses that maintain their own sites. However, this is not a quality to be overlooked, because it reflects the web host's dedication to customer service, which also impacts managed hosting.

If a web hosting client meets the basic qualifications, then it's time to take a close look at its managed hosting options. These typically come in two forms: Dedicated Server, in which a business leases a computer for its exclusive use, and Virtual Private Server, in which a business leases a portion of computer that acts like an exclusive piece of equipment. Choosing one of these options again boils down to how large and complicated the web site functions are.

In either case, the managed hosting aspect should be the same. The web hosting service contracts with the business to handle all of the administration of its web site. This arrangement frees the business from the expense of buying equipment and hiring staff at the same time it assures a continual, reliable Internet presence.

Article Source: <a href = "http://www.articlesengine.com/Article/How-To-Decide-If-Managed-Hosting-Is-Right-For-Your-Business/533401/1">Articles Engine</a>
]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<title>Mac OS X Security Update 2010-003</title>
<link>http://www.alecksdad.com/mac-os-x-security-update-2010-00/</link>
<pubDate>Tue, 20 Apr 2010 09:44:34 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel]]></dc:creator>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="os-x"><![CDATA[OS X]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="osx"><![CDATA[OSX]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Security]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="security"><![CDATA[Security]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="software"><![CDATA[Software]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="updates"><![CDATA[Updates]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.alecksdad.com/?p=900</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align:center;"><img src="http://www.alecksdad.com/http://www.alecksdad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/Screen-shot-2010-04-20-at-10.41.23.png" alt="Screen shot 2010-04-20 at 10.41.23.png" border="0" width="514" height="622" /></div>

Enormous security update from Apple today !

Weighing in at a whole 6.3MB!

The enigmatic details from Apple read as:

<blockquote>Security Update 2010-003 is recommended for all users and improves the security of Mac OS X.

For information on the security content of this update, please visit this website: <a href="http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222">http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222</a>.</blockquote>

But please note, restart is required!]]></content:encoded>
